analyzed: de chos thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin pa dang / de 'dren pa yin pa dang / de ston pa yin pas na lha dang mi rnams la sdug bsngal thams cad las byung ba yang dag par ston cing /

original: rnam par brjod pas na de'i phyir lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par brjod pas na de'i phyir lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is the one who teaches and explains, therefore it is called the teacher of gods and humans.

original: don dang ldan pa'i chos kyi tshogs dang / don dang mi ldan pa'i chos kyi tshogs dang / don dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: don dang ldan pa'i chos kyi tshogs dang / don dang mi ldan pa'i chos kyi tshogs dang / don dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: The collection of dharmas endowed with meaning, the collection of dharmas not endowed with meaning, the collection of dharmas not endowed with meaning,

analyzed: don dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa'i chos kyi tshogs mtha' dag rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par @50a * //
translated: It is not a collection of teachings that is meaningless.üîΩ

original: thugs su chud pas na sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //üîΩbdud dpung dang bcas pa thams cad kyi g-yul chen po bcom pas na /
analyzed: thugs su chud pas na sangs rgyas zhes bya'o // bdud dpung dang bcas pa thams cad kyi g-yul chen po bcom pas na /

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya'o //üîΩde la bskal pa du mar yang sangs rgyas gcig kyang mi 'byung la /üîΩbskal pa gcig la yang sangs rgyas mang po 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya'o // de la bskal pa du mar yang sangs rgyas gcig kyang mi 'byung la / bskal pa gcig la yang sangs rgyas mang po 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: He is called Bhagavat because he has conquered the great army of Mara and its forces.üîΩIt should be understood that in some world systems a single Buddha appears, while in others many Buddhas appear.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa grangs med pa de dang de dag tu sangs rgyas dpag tu med grangs med pa dag 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa grangs med pa de dang de dag tu sangs rgyas dpag tu med grangs med pa dag 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: In this way, in countless world systems in the ten directions, countless Buddhas appear.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: phyogs bcu dag na byang chub sems dpa' dpag tu med pa grangs med pa gang dag dus gcig tu smon lam btab pa dang / tshogs yang dag par sgrub pa mtshungs pa dag yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phyogs bcu dag na byang chub sems dpa' dpag tu med pa grangs med pa gang dag dus gcig tu smon lam btab pa dang / tshogs yang dag par sgrub pa mtshungs pa dag yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there are innumerable, countless bodhisattvas in the ten directions who make prayers at the same time and who are equal in their perfect accomplishment of the accumulations.

original: zhag dang zla ba phyed pa dang / zla ba dang lo gang kho na la byang chub sems dpa' gcig gis byang chub sems kyis smon lam btab pa de'i nyin mo dang / zla ba phyed dang / zla ba dang / lo de kho na la thams cad kyis smon lam btab ste /
analyzed: zhag dang zla ba phyed pa dang / zla ba dang lo gang kho na la byang chub sems dpa' gcig gis byang chub sems kyis smon lam btab pa de'i nyin mo dang / zla ba phyed dang / zla ba dang / lo de kho na la thams cad kyis smon lam btab ste /
translated: In the same day, month, fortnight, month and year that a single bodhisattva makes prayers with the bodhicitta, all of them make prayers on that very day, month, fortnight, month and year.

original: gcig gis ji ltar spro ba bskyed pa dang / bsgrub pa dang / brtsal ba de bzhin du kun gyis kyang btsal te /
analyzed: gcig gis ji ltar spro ba bskyed pa dang / bsgrub pa dang / brtsal ba de bzhin du kun gyis kyang btsal te /

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams 'di nyid na yang byang chub sems dpa' brgya phrag du ma gang dag dus gcig tu smon lam 'debs pa dang / stong pa mtshungs pa dang / tshul khrims mtshungs pa dang / bzod pa mtshungs pa dang / brtson 'grus mtshungs pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams 'di nyid na yang byang chub sems dpa' brgya phrag du ma gang dag dus gcig tu smon lam 'debs pa dang / stong pa mtshungs pa dang / tshul khrims mtshungs pa dang / bzod pa mtshungs pa dang / brtson 'grus mtshungs pa dang /
translated: In this very world system there are many hundreds of bodhisattvas who simultaneously make aspirations, and who are similar in emptiness, similar in morality, similar in patience, similar in effort,üîΩsimilar in concentration, and similar in wisdom.

original: ting nge 'dzin mtshungs pa dang / shes rab mtshungs pa dag snang na phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag na lta ci smos /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mtshungs pa dang / shes rab mtshungs pa dag snang na phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag na lta ci smos /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing stong gsum gyi stong chen po yang phyogs bcu dag na dpag tu med grangs med pa dag yod do //
translated: In the ten directions there are innumerable buddha fields of a billion-world universe.

original: byang chub sems dpa' tshogs yang dag par sgrub pa mtshungs pa gnyis 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig tu cig car byung ba'i skabs kyang med na dpag tu med grangs med pa dag na lta ci smos /

original: tshogs mtshungs pa rnams rim gyis go rims su byung ba yang mi rigs la /
analyzed: tshogs mtshungs pa rnams rim gyis go rims su byung ba yang mi rigs la /

translated: Therefore, in the ten directions, in as many pure world spheres as there are, it should be understood that bodhisattvas who have accumulated the same requisites appear in different world spheres.

analyzed: de'i phyir rnam grangs 'dis 'jig rten gyi khams mang po dag tu sangs rgyas mang po 'byung ba dag rigs kyi /

analyzed: de ltar yun ring po nas smon lam bskyed pa yang dag par bsgrub pa'i yongs su bzung ba de 'grub pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: That aspiration, which has been made for a long time, is fulfilled by the attainment of that goal.

analyzed: yang de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gis kyang stong gsum gyi stong chen po sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig tu sangs rgyas kyi phrin las thams cad mdzad par spyod do //
translated: And one TathƒÅgata performs all the activities of a Buddha in one great billion-world universe.

translated: Moreover, when a single TathƒÅgata appears in the world, the accomplishment of the individual aims of sentient beings is much greater and more extensive.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: de dag 'di snyam du sems te /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'gro ba ma lus pa la 'di gcig pur zad de / gnyis su med na 'di ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs sam /

analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur na ni /
translated: there is no second. If he goes on a journey or passes into final nirvƒÅ·πáa,

analyzed: gzhan gang gis thad du bdag cag gis tshangs par spyod pa spyad par bya ba'am /

translated: Having understood that there is no second thing to be done, they live the holy life and they quickly generate a very strong aspiration and effort to listen to the holy Dharma.

analyzed: de dag gis sangs rgyas mang po mthong du zin na skyen par mi byed de /

analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas gcig byung na de dag ni rang gi don gyi bya ba 'grub pa ches mang bar 'gyur zhing ches mthun par @51a * //
translated: Thus, when a single Buddha appears, they accomplish their own aims much more and they are much more harmonious.

original: 'gyur ro // de la sangs rgyas thams cad ni gnas bzhi po sku tshe dang / mtshan dang / gdung dang / sku ma gtogs par thams cad mtshungs shing mnyam ste /üîΩkhyad par med do //

analyzed: bud med kyis kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ste /

translated: Because bodhisattvas, from the time they pass beyond the first incalculable eon, have abandoned the state of being a woman.üîΩUntil they sit on the seat of enlightenment, they never become a woman.

translated: Thus, this unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment is to be known as it really is, just as it has been described, also by its very nature.

original: dam par gyur pa dang / yon tan brjod pa dang / rjes su dran pa dang / 'byung ba dang / khyad par gyis kyang de skad bstan pa bzhin yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas las byang chub kyi le'ur ste bdun pa'o /

original: de la thob par bya ba'i don ni bla na med pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: de la thob par bya ba'i don ni bla na med pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: Therein, the object to be attained is unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: 'thob pa'i thabs ni byang chub sems dpa'i slob pa'i lam thams cad do //
analyzed: 'thob pa'i thabs ni byang chub sems dpa'i slob pa'i lam thams cad do //
translated: The means of attaining it is the entire path of training of the bodhisattva.

original: de bzhin du legs par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du legs par gsungs pa /

original: lags par bsnyad pa /
analyzed: lags par bsnyad pa /

original: legs par brjod pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: legs par brjod pa 'di lta ste /

original: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde la sogs pa'i chos rnams la dad pa dang dang ba sngon du 'gro ba'i nges pa dang 'dod pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde la sogs pa'i chos rnams la dad pa dang dang ba sngon du 'gro ba'i nges pa dang 'dod pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: such as the sutra collection, the geya collection, the vyakarana collection, and so on. One has certainty and desire.

original: de la mos pa'i gnas rnam pa brgyad po 'di la rgyu gnyis kyis byang chub sems dpa'i mos pa mang bar 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la mos pa'i gnas rnam pa brgyad po 'di la rgyu gnyis kyis byang chub sems dpa'i mos pa mang bar 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /

original: mos pa la goms pa lan mang du byed pa dang / bzod pa drag po yod pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa la goms pa lan mang du byed pa dang / bzod pa drag po yod pa'o //
translated: Faith is increased by frequent practice and by intense patience.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' chos tshol bas ci zhig tshol /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' chos tshol bas ci zhig tshol /
translated: What does the bodhisattva seek by seeking the Dharma?

original: ji ltar tshol ci'i phyir tshol zhe na /üîΩmdor bsdu @52a * //
analyzed: ji ltar tshol ci'i phyir tshol zhe na / mdor bsdu @52a * //
translated: How does he seek it? And why does he seek it?

original: na byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod tshol ba'o //
analyzed: na byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod tshol ba'o //

analyzed: nyan thos kyi sde snod dang / phyi rol gyi bstan bcos rnams dang / 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang / las kyi gnas shes pa rnams tshol lo //
translated: He seeks the sravaka collection, the outside treatises, and the knowledge of worldly crafts and occupations.

original: de la gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis las shin tu rgyas pa'i sde snod gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod yin no //
analyzed: de la gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis las shin tu rgyas pa'i sde snod gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod yin no //
translated: Among the twelve branches of the scriptures, the bodhisattva collection is the bodhisattva's collection.

original: lhag ma ni nyan thos kyi sde snod yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni nyan thos kyi sde snod yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The remaining scriptures are to be known as the scriptural collection of the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: phyi rol gyi bstan bcos rnams ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi bstan bcos rnams ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /

original: gtan tshigs kyi bstan bcos dang / sgra'i bstan bcos dang / gso ba'i bstan bcos so //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi bstan bcos dang / sgra'i bstan bcos dang / gso ba'i bstan bcos so //
translated: the treatises on logic, the treatises on grammar, and the treatises on healing.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang / las kyi gnas ni rnam pa du ma rnam pa sna tshogs mang po yod de /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang / las kyi gnas ni rnam pa du ma rnam pa sna tshogs mang po yod de /

original: gser ma gar dang / lcags mgar dang / nor bu mkhan gyi las shes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gser ma gar dang / lcags mgar dang / nor bu mkhan gyi las shes pa la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: rig pa'i gnas kyis yongs su bsdus pa de dag thams cad ni rig pa'i gnas lnga po dag yin te /

analyzed: nang gi rig pa dang / gtan tshigs kyi rig pa dang / sgra'i rig pa dang / nad gso ba'i rig pa dang / bzo dang las kyi gnas kyi rig pa'o //
translated: the inner science, the science of logic, the science of grammar, the science of healing, and the science of the arts and crafts.

original: byang chub sems dpas btsal pa gang yin pa de ni rig pa'i gnas lnga po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas btsal pa gang yin pa de ni rig pa'i gnas lnga po 'di dag yin te /

original: de ltar na des rig pa'i gnas thams cad btsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na des rig pa'i gnas thams cad btsal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, he has investigated all the branches of learning.

analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab ni nang gi bstan bcos zhes bya ste /
translated: The Buddha's scriptures are called the internal treatises.

original: de yang rnam pa dus 'jug / de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang / las kyi gnas shes pa'i bar du rnam pa dus 'jug ce na /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa dus 'jug / de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang / las kyi gnas shes pa'i bar du rnam pa dus 'jug ce na /
translated: How many types of internal treatises are there?

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis kyis 'jug ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis kyis 'jug ste /
translated: The Buddha's scriptures are briefly of two types:

original: gtan tshigs kyi bstan bcos kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi bstan bcos kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The treatises on logic are also of two types:

original: pha rol klan ka tshol ba brjod pa'i phan yon ston pa'i rnam pa dang / gzhan las byung ba de lta bu smra ba las thar pa'i phan yon ston pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol klan ka tshol ba brjod pa'i phan yon ston pa'i rnam pa dang / gzhan las byung ba de lta bu smra ba las thar pa'i phan yon ston pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: those that teach the benefits of expressing objections to others and those that teach the benefits of liberation from such talk.

original: sgra'i bstan bcos kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sgra'i bstan bcos kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The treatises on grammar are of two types:

original: gso ba'i bstan bcos ni rnam pa bzhis 'jug ste /
analyzed: gso ba'i bstan bcos ni rnam pa bzhis 'jug ste /

original: 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang / las kyi gnas shes pa rnams ni rang rang gi bzo dang / las kyi gnas sgrub pa'i 'bras bu yongs su grub pa ston pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang / las kyi gnas shes pa rnams ni rang rang gi bzo dang / las kyi gnas sgrub pa'i 'bras bu yongs su grub pa ston pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The treatises on worldly crafts and occupations are presented in terms of the results of accomplishing each craft and occupation.

original: ji ltar na sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab rgyu dang 'bras bu phyin ci ma log pa ston ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab rgyu dang 'bras bu phyin ci ma log pa ston ce na /

translated: The ten causes are the cause of non-separation, the cause of arising, the cause of support, the cause of birth, the cause of increase, the cause of transformation, the cause of manifestation, the cause of the attainment of results, the cause of the accomplishment of action, and the cause of the accomplishment of the view.üîΩThe ten causes are the cause of non-separation, the cause of arising, the cause of support, the cause of birth, the cause of increase, the cause of transformation, the cause of manifestation, the cause of the attainment of results, the cause of the accomplishment of action, and the cause of the accomplishment of the view.üîΩThe ten causes are the cause of non-separation, the cause of arising, the cause of support, the cause of birth, the cause of increase, the cause of transformation, the cause of manifestation, the cause of the attainment of results, the cause of the accomplishment of action, and the cause of the accomplishment of the view.üîΩThe ten causes are the cause of non-separation, the cause of arising, the cause of support, the cause of birth, the cause of increase, the cause of transformation, the cause of manifestation, the cause of the attainment of results, the cause of the accomplishment of action, and the cause of the accomplishment of the view.üîΩThe ten causes are the cause of non-separation, the cause of arising, the cause of support, the cause of birth, the cause of increase, the cause of transformation, the cause of manifestation, the cause of the attainment of results, the cause of the accomplishment of action, and the cause of the accomplishment of the view.üîΩThe ten causes are the cause of non-separation, the cause of arising, the cause of support, the cause of birth, the cause of increase, the cause of transformation, the cause of manifestation, the cause of the attainment of results, the cause of the accomplishment of action, and the cause of the accomplishment of the view.

original: mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang / mi mthun pa med pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang / mi mthun pa med pa'i rgyu'o //

original: de la chos thams cad kyi ming dang / ming sngon du 'gro ba'i 'du shes dang / 'du shes sngon du 'gro ba'i brjod pa gang yin pa de ni chos de dang de dag gi rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de la chos thams cad kyi ming dang / ming sngon du 'gro ba'i 'du shes dang / 'du shes sngon du 'gro ba'i brjod pa gang yin pa de ni chos de dang de dag gi rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The name of all things, the perception preceded by the name, and the expression preceded by the perception are the causes of the conventional designation of this and that thing.

original: de la gang la ltos shing rgyu gang las byung ba dngos po gang la 'dod pa dang len par gyur pa de ni de'i ltos pa'i rgyu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la gang la ltos shing rgyu gang las byung ba dngos po gang la 'dod pa dang len par gyur pa de ni de'i ltos pa'i rgyu zhes bya ste /
translated: The thing that depends on something and arises from a cause, and with regard to which there is desire and grasping, is called the dependent cause of that.

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩlag pa la ltos shing lag pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni len pa'i las so //üîΩrkang pa la ltos shing rkang pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i las so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / lag pa la ltos shing lag pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni len pa'i las so // rkang pa la ltos shing rkang pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i las so //
translated: For example,üîΩthe action of grasping depends on the hand and arises from the cause of the hand.üîΩThe action of going and coming depends on the foot and arises from the cause of the foot.

original: tshigs la ltos shing tshigs kyi rgyu las byung ba ni bskum pa dang brkyang ba'i las so //
analyzed: tshigs la ltos shing tshigs kyi rgyu las byung ba ni bskum pa dang brkyang ba'i las so //
translated: The action of bending and stretching depends on the joint and arises from the cause of the joint.

original: bkres pa dang skom pa la ltos shing bkres pa dang skom pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni zas dang skom len pa dang tshol ba yin te /
analyzed: bkres pa dang skom pa la ltos shing bkres pa dang skom pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni zas dang skom len pa dang tshol ba yin te /
translated: The cause of dependence is the cause of the search for and acquisition of food and drink, which are dependent on hunger and thirst, and which arise from the causes of hunger and thirst.

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa tshad med pa'i yul dang ldan pa ni ltos pa'i rgyu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa tshad med pa'i yul dang ldan pa ni ltos pa'i rgyu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The cause of dependence should be understood as the cause of immeasurable objects that are similar to this.

original: de la sa bon ni rang gi 'bras bu tha ma'i bar gyi 'phen pa'i rgyu yin no //üîΩsa bon ma gtogs par de las @53a * //
analyzed: de la sa bon ni rang gi 'bras bu tha ma'i bar gyi 'phen pa'i rgyu yin no // sa bon ma gtogs par de las @53a * //
translated: The seed is the projecting cause of its fruit up to the final fruit.

original: gzhan pa'i rkyen ni yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gzhan pa'i rkyen ni yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The condition that is other than the seed is the supporting cause.

original: sa bon de nyid ni rang gi 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sa bon de nyid ni rang gi 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no //

original: sa bon las grub pa'i 'bras bu de ni sa bon gyis 'phangs pa'i 'bras bu phyi ma'i 'dren pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sa bon las grub pa'i 'bras bu de ni sa bon gyis 'phangs pa'i 'bras bu phyi ma'i 'dren pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The fruit that is established from the seed is the cause of the subsequent attraction of the fruit that was projected by the seed.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs rnam pa tha dad pa'i rgyu nyid ni so sor nges pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs rnam pa tha dad pa'i rgyu nyid ni so sor nges pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause of the various different aspects is the cause of determination.

original: ltos pa'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / 'phen pa'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / 'dren pa'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / so sor nges pa'i rgyu gang yin pa'i rgyu de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ltos pa'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / 'phen pa'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / 'dren pa'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / so sor nges pa'i rgyu gang yin pa'i rgyu de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: The cause of dependence, the projecting cause, the cause of support, the cause of manifestation, the cause of guidance, and the cause of determination‚Äîall these causes together are called the cooperating cause.

original: skye ba la bar du gcod pa'i rgyu ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: skye ba la bar du gcod pa'i rgyu ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu yin no //

original: bar du gcod pa med pa ni mi mthun pa med pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa med pa ni mi mthun pa med pa'i rgyu yin no //

analyzed: de la mi mthun pa'i rgyu ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The opposing cause is of six kinds in brief:

original: tshig mi mthun pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshig mi mthun pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The opposing cause of words is, for example,

original: dge sbyong dang / bram ze kha cig gi bstan bcos snga phyi mi mthun pa rnams lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dge sbyong dang / bram ze kha cig gi bstan bcos snga phyi mi mthun pa rnams lta bu yin no //
translated: the treatises of some ≈õrama·πáas and brahmans that are contradictory in the beginning, middle, and end.

original: rigs pa dang 'gal ba ni sgrub par byed pa shes par bya ba'i don sgrub pa la 'thad par sgrub pa'i rigs pa mi rung ba yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa dang 'gal ba ni sgrub par byed pa shes par bya ba'i don sgrub pa la 'thad par sgrub pa'i rigs pa mi rung ba yin no //

original: skye ba dang mi mthun pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: skye ba dang mi mthun pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen med pa dang / skye ba la bar du gcod pa'i chos yod na ;

analyzed: skye bar mi 'gyur ba lta bu yin no //
translated: origination does not occur.

original: lhan cig gnas pa mi mthun pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lhan cig gnas pa mi mthun pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Incongruity of co-existence is as follows:

analyzed: snang ba dang mun pa gnyis dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gnyis dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyis lta bu yin no //
translated: light and darkness, attachment and aversion, pleasure and pain.

original: mi 'phrod pa'i mi mthun pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi 'phrod pa'i mi mthun pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Incongruity of incompatibility is as follows:

original: sbrul dang sre mong gnyis dang / byi la dang ; byi ba gnyis dang / gcig la gcig phyir rgol zhing dgrar gyur pa gnyis lta bu yin no //
analyzed: sbrul dang sre mong gnyis dang / byi la dang ; byi ba gnyis dang / gcig la gcig phyir rgol zhing dgrar gyur pa gnyis lta bu yin no //

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi mi mthun pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi mi mthun pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Incongruity of the discordant and antidotes is as follows:

original: mi sdug pa bsgom pa dang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags gnyis dang / byams pa bsgom pa dang gnod sems gnyis dang ; snying rje bsgom pa dang rnam par 'tshe ba gnyis dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom pa dang /
analyzed: mi sdug pa bsgom pa dang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags gnyis dang / byams pa bsgom pa dang gnod sems gnyis dang ; snying rje bsgom pa dang rnam par 'tshe ba gnyis dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom pa dang /
translated: Meditation on ugliness and attachment to sense objects, meditation on loving kindness and malice, meditation on compassion and violence, meditation on the branches of enlightenment and the eightfold noble path and the afflictions.üîΩ

original: khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad lta bu yin no //
analyzed: khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad lta bu yin no //

translated: Thus, having realized the Buddha's teachings that perfectly reveal causes and effects, bodhisattvas gradually purify their potential by means of the power of knowledge of what is possible and impossible and by means of the cause, teaching the potential.üîΩ

original: 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: 'phel bar byed do //
translated: Thus, having understood the Buddha‚Äôs teachings that perfectly reveal causes and effects, the bodhisattva, through the power of knowing the possible and impossible, gradually purifies and increases the potential through teaching the Dharma to those with the potential.

original: de bzhin du ma byas pa dang phrad par mi 'gyur ba dang / byas pa chud mi za ba sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab bstan pa yang byang chub sems dpas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs nas /

analyzed: las bdag gir bya ba shes pa'i stobs kyis rigs rim gyis rnam par dag par byed cing rnam par 'phel bar byed do //

original: de la ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' thos pa tshol zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' thos pa tshol zhe na /

translated: If the bodhisattva thinks, If I do not act like this, I will not hear the well-spoken, then with supreme joy and respect, he will even walk on burning hot iron ground.

analyzed: legs par gsungs pa mang po'i phyir lta ci smos /

original: bdag gi lus kyi khog pa la dga' ba dang ; gus pa gang yin pa dang / legs par gsungs pa mnyan pa la dga' ba dang / gus pa gang yin pa las dga' ba dang / gus pa snga ma ni dga' ba dang gus pa phyi ma dang sbyar na brgya'i char yang mi phod do //

analyzed: de de ltar 'gro ba dang ldan pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba med par chos nyan to //
translated: Thus, he listens to the Dharma without mental distraction and without defilement.

original: ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa med par nyan ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa med par nyan ce na /
translated: How does he listen without defilement?

original: khengs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang / khyad du gsod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang / zhum pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bas so //
analyzed: khengs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang / khyad du gsod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang / zhum pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bas so //
translated: He is free from the defilement of pride, free from the defilement of contempt, and free from the defilement of discouragement.

original: de la rnam pa drug gis ni khengs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de la rnam pa drug gis ni khengs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur /
translated: He is free from the defilement of pride in six ways:

original: rnam pa bzhis ni khyad du gsod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhis ni khyad du gsod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur /
translated: He is free from the defilement of contempt in four ways:

original: rnam pa gcig gis ni zhum pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig gis ni zhum pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: He is free from the defilement of discouragement in one way:

original: dus su nyan pa dang / bkur sti byed pa dang / srid zhu byed pa dang / mi khro ba dang / rjes su sgrub pa dang / klan ka mi tshol ba dang / rnam pa drug po 'di dag gis ni khengs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus su nyan pa dang / bkur sti byed pa dang / srid zhu byed pa dang / mi khro ba dang / rjes su sgrub pa dang / klan ka mi tshol ba dang / rnam pa drug po 'di dag gis ni khengs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He is free from the defilement of pride in six ways: he listens at the proper time, he shows respect, he is not angry, he practices as directed, he does not seek for faults, and he is not interested in other teachings.üîΩHe is free from the defilement of contempt in four ways: he is not contemptuous of the teaching, he is not contemptuous of the words, he is not contemptuous of the person, and he is not contemptuous of the opportunity.

original: chos la gus pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos smra ba'i gang zag la gus pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos la khyad du mi gsod pa dang / chos smra ba'i gang zag la khyad du mi gsod pa dang / rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis ni khyad du gsod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar nyan no //
analyzed: chos la gus pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos smra ba'i gang zag la gus pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos la khyad du mi gsod pa dang / chos smra ba'i gang zag la khyad du mi gsod pa dang / rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis ni khyad du gsod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar nyan no //
translated: He listens without the defilement of contempt, free from the four kinds of contempt: contempt for the Dharma, contempt for the person who teaches the Dharma, contempt for the Dharma itself, and contempt for the person who teaches the Dharma.

original: bdag nyid la khyad du mi gsod par nyan par byed do //
analyzed: bdag nyid la khyad du mi gsod par nyan par byed do //
translated: He listens without contempt for himself.

original: rnam pa gcig po 'dis zhum pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bas nyan par byed de /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig po 'dis zhum pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bas nyan par byed de /
translated: By this one aspect he listens without the defilement of faintheartedness.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' kun nas nyon mongs pa med par chos nyan pa yin no //üîΩde la ji ltar na @57a * //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' kun nas nyon mongs pa med par chos nyan pa yin no // de la ji ltar na @57a * //
translated: Thus the bodhisattva listens to the Dharma without defilement.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par mi g-yeng bar chos nyan ce na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par mi g-yeng bar chos nyan ce na /
translated: How does the bodhisattva listen to the Dharma without distraction?

original: rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: In five ways:

original: kun shes par bya ba'i sems dang ldan pa dang / sems rtse gcig pa dang / rna blags pa dang / yid btud pa dang / sems kun gyis bsams nas chos nyan pa nyan nus te /
analyzed: kun shes par bya ba'i sems dang ldan pa dang / sems rtse gcig pa dang / rna blags pa dang / yid btud pa dang / sems kun gyis bsams nas chos nyan pa nyan nus te /
translated: He listens with a mind that is all-knowing, with a one-pointed mind, with ears pricked up, with a humble mind, and with a mind that is fully attentive.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de ltar thos pa tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de ltar thos pa tshol bar byed do //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva seeks learning.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' ci'i phyir thos pa tshol bar byed ce na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' ci'i phyir thos pa tshol bar byed ce na /
translated: Why does the bodhisattva seek learning?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi nan tan gyis yang dag par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir dang / gzhan dag la yang rgya char yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi bka' yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi nan tan gyis yang dag par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir dang / gzhan dag la yang rgya char yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi bka' yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva seeks the Buddha's word in order to accomplish it through practice that accords with the Dharma and in order to teach it extensively to others.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gtan tshigs kyi rig pa tshol bar byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gtan tshigs kyi rig pa tshol bar byed de /
translated: The bodhisattva seeks the knowledge of reasoning.

original: bstan bcos de nyid la nyes par bshad pa dang / nyes par brjod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir dang / phas kyi rgol ba tshar gcad pa'i phyir dang / bstan pa 'di la ma dad pa rnams dad par bya ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: bstan bcos de nyid la nyes par bshad pa dang / nyes par brjod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir dang / phas kyi rgol ba tshar gcad pa'i phyir dang / bstan pa 'di la ma dad pa rnams dad par bya ba'i phyir dang /
translated: In order to understand the faults of the treatises and the correct way to respond to them, in order to defeat opponents, in order to generate faith in those who do not have faith in the teaching, and

original: dad pa rnams kyang phyir zhing 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pa rnams kyang phyir zhing 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to increase the faith of those who do have faith.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sgra'i rig pa tshol bar byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sgra'i rig pa tshol bar byed de /
translated: A bodhisattva seeks knowledge of language.

original: tshig dang yi ge nges pa'i tshig bzang po dpyod pas legs par sbyar te /
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge nges pa'i tshig bzang po dpyod pas legs par sbyar te /
translated: By analyzing the good words and letters of the treatises, he or she seeks to understand the correct use of language.

original: brjod pa la mos pa rnams bdag la yid ches pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang / don gcig la yang nges pa'i tshig rnam pa sna tshogs kyis rjes su tha snyad gdags pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod pa la mos pa rnams bdag la yid ches pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang / don gcig la yang nges pa'i tshig rnam pa sna tshogs kyis rjes su tha snyad gdags pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is in order to generate confidence in those who are interested in eloquence and in order to engage in the various etymologies of a single meaning.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gso ba'i bstan bcos tshol bar byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gso ba'i bstan bcos tshol bar byed de /
translated: A bodhisattva seeks knowledge of the healing arts.

original: sems can rnams kyi nad rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par zhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang / skye bo'i tshogs chen po la phan gdags par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi nad rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par zhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang / skye bo'i tshogs chen po la phan gdags par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to pacify the various sicknesses of sentient beings and in order to benefit a great multitude of people.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang las kyi gnas shes pa rnams tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang las kyi gnas shes pa rnams tshol bar byed do //
translated: Bodhisattvas seek the knowledge of worldly arts and crafts

original: sems can rnams kyi don du tshogs chung ngus longs spyod bsgrub pa'i phyir dang ; sems can rnams kyis gces par bya ba bskyed pa'i phyir dang / bzo dang las kyi gnas shes pa sbyin pa'i phan 'dogs pas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don du tshogs chung ngus longs spyod bsgrub pa'i phyir dang ; sems can rnams kyis gces par bya ba bskyed pa'i phyir dang / bzo dang las kyi gnas shes pa sbyin pa'i phan 'dogs pas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to provide for their enjoyment with little effort for the sake of sentient beings, in order to generate affection in sentient beings, and in order to attract them by the benefit of giving the knowledge of arts and crafts.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rig pa'i gnas lnga po 'di dag thams cad tshol yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi @57b ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rig pa'i gnas lnga po 'di dag thams cad tshol yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi @57b ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Although bodhisattvas seek all these five sciences, they do so in order to complete the great accumulation of wisdom for the attainment of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: thams cad la de ltar ma bslabs na rim gyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes sgrib pa med pa thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad la de ltar ma bslabs na rim gyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes sgrib pa med pa thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not train in this way in all the perfections, one will not attain the unobstructed knowledge of a completely enlightened Buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang tshol ba dang / ji ltar tshol ba dang / gang gi phyir tshol ba de ni bshad zin to ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang tshol ba dang / ji ltar tshol ba dang / gang gi phyir tshol ba de ni bshad zin to ;
translated: The bodhisattva has already been explained as to what he seeks, how he seeks, and why he seeks.

original: / de la byang chub sems dpas gzhan dag la ci zhig ston ci ltar ston /
analyzed: / de la byang chub sems dpas gzhan dag la ci zhig ston ci ltar ston /
translated: What does the bodhisattva teach to others? How does he teach?

original: ci'i phyir ston ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ston ce na /
translated: Why does he teach?

original: de la gang btsal ba de nyid ston to //
analyzed: de la gang btsal ba de nyid ston to //
translated: He teaches what he himself has sought.

original: gang gi phyir btsal ba de nyid kyi phyir gzhan dag la ston to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir btsal ba de nyid kyi phyir gzhan dag la ston to //
translated: He teaches others for the very same reason that he seeks.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis ston te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis ston te /
translated: He teaches in two ways:

original: mthun pa'i phyir gtam brjod pa dang / yongs su dag pas so //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyir gtam brjod pa dang / yongs su dag pas so //
translated: by conversation that is appropriate and by complete purity.

original: de la ji ltar na mthun pa'i gtam brjod ce na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na mthun pa'i gtam brjod ce na /
translated: How is it that he teaches by conversation that is appropriate?

original: spyod lam gyi tshul dang mthun pa'i gnas pa la ston gyis /
analyzed: spyod lam gyi tshul dang mthun pa'i gnas pa la ston gyis /
translated: He teaches in a way that is appropriate to the behavior of those who are to be trained,

original: tshul dang mi mthun pa la ma yin te /
analyzed: tshul dang mi mthun pa la ma yin te /
translated: not in a way that is inappropriate.

original: min par stan ches mtho ba la 'dug pa la ma yin /
analyzed: min par stan ches mtho ba la 'dug pa la ma yin /
translated: He does not teach while sitting on a high seat,

original: mgo g-yogs pa la ma yin /
analyzed: mgo g-yogs pa la ma yin /
translated: not to the deceitful,

original: mdun du 'gro ba la ma yin te /
analyzed: mdun du 'gro ba la ma yin te /
translated: not to those who go in front.

original: rgyas par mdo las ji skad byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par mdo las ji skad byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in detail as it is taught in the sutras.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: chos ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the Dharma is the teacher of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: chos la bkur sti byas na gzhan dag kyang shas cher chos la gus pa bskyad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: chos la bkur sti byas na gzhan dag kyang shas cher chos la gus pa bskyad par 'gyur la /
translated: When one honors the Dharma, others will be inspired to respect the Dharma.

original: nyan pa'i tshe yang gus par byed cing khyad du gsod par mi byed do ;
analyzed: nyan pa'i tshe yang gus par byed cing khyad du gsod par mi byed do ;
translated: When one listens to the Dharma, one does so with respect and does not slight it.

original: / chos la ser sna mi byed pa dang / chos rnams la slob dpon gyis dpe mkhyud mi byed par thams cad la ston cing rgyun mi 'chad par thams cad la ston to //
analyzed: / chos la ser sna mi byed pa dang / chos rnams la slob dpon gyis dpe mkhyud mi byed par thams cad la ston cing rgyun mi 'chad par thams cad la ston to //
translated: One does not be stingy with the Dharma, and one does not hold back the Dharma as a teacher might do. One teaches it to everyone, and one teaches it to everyone continuously.

original: tshig dang yi ge go rims bzhin du ston cing /
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge go rims bzhin du ston cing /
translated: One teaches the words and letters in the proper order.

original: tshig dang yi ge go rims bzhin du bstan nas kyang /
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge go rims bzhin du bstan nas kyang /
translated: Having taught the words and letters in the proper order,

original: go rims kho na bzhin du don rnam par 'byed do //
analyzed: go rims kho na bzhin du don rnam par 'byed do //
translated: one analyzes the meaning in the proper order.

original: chos kyang don dang ldan pa dang / don yang chos dang ldan par ston cing 'chad kyi /
analyzed: chos kyang don dang ldan pa dang / don yang chos dang ldan par ston cing 'chad kyi /
translated: He teaches and explains the Dharma in a way that is meaningful and meaningful in a way that accords with the Dharma.

original: don dang mi ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dang mi ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: He does not teach what is meaningless.

original: yang dag par bstan par 'os pa rnams la ni yang dag par ston /üîΩyang dag par 'dzin du gzhug par 'os pa rnams la ni yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug /
analyzed: yang dag par bstan par 'os pa rnams la ni yang dag par ston / yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug par 'os pa rnams la ni yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug /
translated: He correctly teaches those who are fit to be taught correctly.üîΩHe correctly instructs those who are fit to be instructed correctly.

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod par 'os pa rnams la ni yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod par 'os pa rnams la ni yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: He correctly encourages those who are fit to be encouraged correctly.

original: yang dag par dga' bar bya bar 'os pa rnams la ni yang dag par dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar bya bar 'os pa rnams la ni yang dag par dga' bar byed do //
translated: He correctly delights those who are fit to be delighted correctly.

original: mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung dang ldan pa'i gtam byed kyi /
analyzed: mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung dang ldan pa'i gtam byed kyi /
translated: He speaks with a discourse that is endowed with direct perception, inference, and trustworthy scripture.

original: tshad ma dang mi ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma dang mi ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: He does not speak with what is not a means of valid knowledge.

original: @58a * // bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / mthun pa dang / 'jug sla zhing glags glags pa ma yin pas rnam par ma 'khrugs pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang ldan pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: @58a * // bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / mthun pa dang / 'jug sla zhing glags glags pa ma yin pas rnam par ma 'khrugs pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang ldan pa la yang ngo //
translated: It is also in accord with the path to happy rebirth, easy to practice, and not too difficult. It is not confused, being endowed with the four noble truths.

original: 'khor thams cad du yang 'khor gang la gtam gang bya bar 'os pa de nyid la gtam de byed de /
analyzed: 'khor thams cad du yang 'khor gang la gtam gang bya bar 'os pa de nyid la gtam de byed de /
translated: And it is appropriate for any assembly, since it is the kind of talk that should be given to any assembly.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gtam ni re zhig rnam pa bco lnga po de dag gis sems can rnams la gzhan gyi don thams cad la mthun pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gtam ni re zhig rnam pa bco lnga po de dag gis sems can rnams la gzhan gyi don thams cad la mthun pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: In these fifteen ways, the bodhisattvas‚Äô talk is in accord with all the aims of beings.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can gnod pa byed pa dag la ni byams pa'i sems nye bar gzhag ste gtam byed do ;
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can gnod pa byed pa dag la ni byams pa'i sems nye bar gzhag ste gtam byed do ;
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattvas‚Äô talk is given with a mind of love toward beings who do them harm.

original: / sems can nyes par spyad pa spyod pa rnams la ni phan pa'i sems nye bar gzhag ste gtam byed do //
analyzed: / sems can nyes par spyad pa spyod pa rnams la ni phan pa'i sems nye bar gzhag ste gtam byed do //
translated: It is given with a mind of benefit toward beings who engage in negative actions.

original: sems can skyid pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bag med pa rnams dang / zhum pa rnams la phan pa dang / bde ba dang snying brtse ba'i sems nye bar gzhag ste gtam byed do //
analyzed: sems can skyid pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bag med pa rnams dang / zhum pa rnams la phan pa dang / bde ba dang snying brtse ba'i sems nye bar gzhag ste gtam byed do //
translated: He speaks with a mind that is helpful, happy, and full of loving concern for beings who are happy, suffering, heedless, or fainthearted.

original: phrag dog gis kun nas dkris pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: phrag dog gis kun nas dkris pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: He speaks with a mind that is free of the entanglements of envy,

original: bdag la stod par mi byed /
analyzed: bdag la stod par mi byed /
translated: not praising himself

original: gzhan la smod par mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhan la smod par mi byed do //
translated: and not disparaging others.

original: zang zing med pa'i sems kyis rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa la mi re bar gzhan dag la chos ston te /
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i sems kyis rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa la mi re bar gzhan dag la chos ston te /
translated: He teaches the Dharma to others with a mind free of interest in material possessions, honor, or fame.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam pa lnga po de dag gis yongs su dag pa'i gtam byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam pa lnga po de dag gis yongs su dag pa'i gtam byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva‚Äôs speech is pure in five ways.

original: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa nyi shur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa nyi shur 'gyur te /
translated: In brief, these are twenty kinds.

original: dus dang bkur sti dang / go rims dang / mtshams sbyor ba dang / rjes su mthun pa dang / dga' bar byed pa dang / 'dod par byed pa dang / mgu bar byed pa dang / spro bar byed pa dang / sma mi 'bebs pa dang /
analyzed: dus dang bkur sti dang / go rims dang / mtshams sbyor ba dang / rjes su mthun pa dang / dga' bar byed pa dang / 'dod par byed pa dang / mgu bar byed pa dang / spro bar byed pa dang / sma mi 'bebs pa dang /
translated: and it delights, pleases, satisfies, and inspires.üîΩIt is not condescending,üîΩnot mixed up,üîΩin accord with the Dharma,üîΩand in accord with the audience.üîΩIt is with a mind of love,üîΩa mind of benefit,üîΩa mind of compassion,üîΩand a mind of sympathy.

original: rig pa dang 'tsham pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / chos dang ldan pa dang / 'khor ji lta ba dang byams pa'i sems dang / phan pa'i sems dang / snying brtse ba'i sems dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa la mi gnas pa dang /
analyzed: rig pa dang 'tsham pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / chos dang ldan pa dang / 'khor ji lta ba dang byams pa'i sems dang / phan pa'i sems dang / snying brtse ba'i sems dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa la mi gnas pa dang /
translated: It is not based on gain, honor, or praise,

original: bdag la mi bstod cing gzhan la mi smod pa ste /
analyzed: bdag la mi bstod cing gzhan la mi smod pa ste /
translated: and it does not praise oneself or disparage others.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de ltar gzhan dag la chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de ltar gzhan dag la chos ston par byed do //
translated: This is how bodhisattvas teach the Dharma to others.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas‚Äô practice in accord with the Dharma?

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be understood as being fivefold:

original: ji ltar yongs su btsal ba dang / ji ltar bzung ba'i chos de dag nyid lus dang @58b ngag dang yid kyis rjes su bsgrub pa dang / legs par sems pa dang / sgom par byed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis chos gang dag lus dang /üîΩngag dang yid kyis byed du ma gnang ba dag dang / gang dag lus dang ngag dang yid kyis byed du ma gnang ba lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las de de kho na bzhin du yongs su spong ba dang / so sor bsten cing yang dag par sdud la /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su btsal ba dang / ji ltar bzung ba'i chos de dag nyid lus dang @58b ngag dang yid kyis rjes su bsgrub pa dang / legs par sems pa dang / sgom par byed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis chos gang dag lus dang / ngag dang yid kyis byed du ma gnang ba dag dang / gang dag lus dang ngag dang yid kyis byed du ma gnang ba lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las de de kho na bzhin du yongs su spong ba dang / so sor bsten cing yang dag par sdud la /
translated: It is the practice of those very teachings that have been sought and grasped, through body, speech, and mind,üîΩand the proper reflection and meditation on them.üîΩIt is the complete abandonment of those things that the Blessed One has not allowed to be done with body, speech, and mind, and the practice of those things that he has allowed to be done with body, speech, and mind.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis rjes su sgrub pa ni chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis rjes su sgrub pa ni chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the practice of the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma, through the cultivation, practice, and frequent performance of those things that have been taken up.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i legs par sems pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i legs par sems pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas‚Äô proper reflection?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ji skad thos pa'i chos rnams bsam par 'dod pa dang / gzhal bar 'dod pa dang / nye bar brtag par 'dod pa ni gcig pu dben par song ste /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ji skad thos pa'i chos rnams bsam par 'dod pa dang / gzhal bar 'dod pa dang / nye bar brtag par 'dod pa ni gcig pu dben par song ste /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva who wishes to contemplate, to investigate, and to examine the teachings as they have been heard, goes alone to an isolated place.

original: thog ma kho nar bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'i gnas rnams spangs nas /
analyzed: thog ma kho nar bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'i gnas rnams spangs nas /
translated: First of all, he abandons the unsuitable as a subject for contemplation.

original: chos rnams bsam pa brtson par byed do //
analyzed: chos rnams bsam pa brtson par byed do //
translated: He then applies himself to contemplating the teachings.

original: rtag tu gus par byed pa'i sbyor bas rgyun du sems par byed do //
analyzed: rtag tu gus par byed pa'i sbyor bas rgyun du sems par byed do //
translated: He contemplates them continuously, with an application that is always respectful.

original: lhod par mi byed do //
analyzed: lhod par mi byed do //
translated: He does not relax his efforts.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems pa la zhugs pa ni la la la ni rigs pas dpyad cing rjes su 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems pa la zhugs pa ni la la la ni rigs pas dpyad cing rjes su 'jug par byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva who is engaged in contemplation proceeds by means of reasoning in regard to some subjects.

original: la la la ni mos pa kho nar byed do //
analyzed: la la la ni mos pa kho nar byed do //
translated: In regard to others, he proceeds by means of faith.

original: sems pa na yang don la rton par byed kyi /
analyzed: sems pa na yang don la rton par byed kyi /
translated: When he contemplates, he relies upon the meaning,

original: tshig 'bru la rton par mi byed do //
analyzed: tshig 'bru la rton par mi byed do //
translated: not upon the letter.

original: nag po bstan pa dang / chen po bstan pa rnams kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes par byed do //
analyzed: nag po bstan pa dang / chen po bstan pa rnams kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes par byed do //
translated: He understands correctly the teachings that are obscure and the teachings that are explicit.

original: thog ma 'jug pa nas kyang sems pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: thog ma 'jug pa nas kyang sems pa la 'jug go //
translated: From the very beginning, he engages in the thought of enlightenment.

original: zhugs nas kyang yang dag yang du yid la byed pas snying po nyid thob par byed do //
analyzed: zhugs nas kyang yang dag yang du yid la byed pas snying po nyid thob par byed do //
translated: Having engaged in it, he makes it his very essence by repeatedly bringing it to mind.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bsam par bya ba ma yin pa spong ba na rmongs pa dang sems g-yengs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bsam par bya ba ma yin pa spong ba na rmongs pa dang sems g-yengs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When the bodhisattva abandons the unthinkable, he does not become confused or distracted.

original: rtag tu gus par byed pa'i sbyor bas rgyun du sems par byed na sngon ma rtogs pa'i don khong du chud cing thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rtag tu gus par byed pa'i sbyor bas rgyun du sems par byed na sngon ma rtogs pa'i don khong du chud cing thob par 'gyur la /
translated: If he always practices with devotion, he will understand and attain the meaning that he has not yet understood and attained.

original: rtogs shing thob par 'gyur ba'i don yang chud za bar mi 'gyur te brjed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtogs shing thob par 'gyur ba'i don yang chud za bar mi 'gyur te brjed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And he will not lose the meaning that he has understood and attained; he will not forget it.

original: la la ni rigs pas rnam par dbye zhing brtags na rigs pas brtags pa'i chos de dag la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la la ni rigs pas rnam par dbye zhing brtags na rigs pas brtags pa'i chos de dag la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Some, when they analyze and examine with reasoning, do not rely on others with regard to those dharmas that are examined with reasoning.

original: la la zhig mos pa'i tshe chos zab mo gang dag la de'i blo 'jug par ma gyur na yang chos de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i @59a * //üîΩspyod yul yin gyi /
analyzed: la la zhig mos pa'i tshe chos zab mo gang dag la de'i blo 'jug par ma gyur na yang chos de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i @59a * // spyod yul yin gyi /
translated: But they do not reject those teachings, thinking, ‚ÄúThese are the domain of the Tathagatas,üîΩbut they are not the domain of my mind.‚Äù

original: bdag gi blo'i spyod yul ma yin no zhes de ltar chos de dag mi spong na bdag nyid ma smas ma nyams par bsrung zhing kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi blo'i spyod yul ma yin no zhes de ltar chos de dag mi spong na bdag nyid ma smas ma nyams par bsrung zhing kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, they protect themselves without being injured or harmed, and they are without offense.

original: byang chub sems dpa' don la rton gyi tshig 'bru la mi rton na ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dgongs te gsungs pa thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' don la rton gyi tshig 'bru la mi rton na ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dgongs te gsungs pa thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: When bodhisattvas rely on the meaning and not on the letter, they follow all the teachings that the Lord Buddha taught with a specific intention.

original: byang chub sems dpa' nag po bstan pa dang / chen po bstan pa la mkhas pa ni de kho na'i don la sus kyang rnam par bskyod pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nag po bstan pa dang / chen po bstan pa la mkhas pa ni de kho na'i don la sus kyang rnam par bskyod pa'am /
translated: The bodhisattvas who are skilled in the teachings of the dark and the bright are not at all shaken from the meaning of reality.

original: rnam par bskul bar ji ltar yang mi nus so //
analyzed: rnam par bskul bar ji ltar yang mi nus so //
translated: They cannot be led away from it.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thog ma nas sems dpa' la 'jug pa ni bzod pa sngon ma thob pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thog ma nas sems dpa' la 'jug pa ni bzod pa sngon ma thob pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattva who has not previously obtained the patience of the nonarising of things obtains it from the first stage of the Joyous.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa thob pa de nyid snying por byed pa ni bsgom pa la rjes su 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa thob pa de nyid snying por byed pa ni bsgom pa la rjes su 'jug pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who has obtained patience makes it his essence to practice it.

original: bsam par bsdus pa rnam pa brgyad po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam par bsdus pa rnam pa brgyad po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: By these eight kinds of thought, the bodhisattva is engaged in the practice of the Dharma in conformity with the Dharma.

original: bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is cultivation?

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be understood as fourfold:

original: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la goms pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la goms pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: tranquillity, insight, cultivation of tranquillity and insight, and delight in tranquillity and insight.

original: de la zhi gnas gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zhi gnas gang zhe na /
translated: What is tranquillity?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa rnam pa brgyad po dag shin tu rdzogs pa'i phyir brjod du med pa'i dngos po tsam dang / don tsam gyi dmigs pa la sems nges par btags nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa rnam pa brgyad po dag shin tu rdzogs pa'i phyir brjod du med pa'i dngos po tsam dang / don tsam gyi dmigs pa la sems nges par btags nas /
translated: The bodhisattva is said to be ‚Äúfixed in attention‚Äù on the object of meditation, which is just a thing or just an object, because he has completely perfected the eight kinds of attention.

original: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba dang / sems yongs su g-yeng ba thams cad dang bral ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas dmigs pa thams cad la mos pas na /
analyzed: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba dang / sems yongs su g-yeng ba thams cad dang bral ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas dmigs pa thams cad la mos pas na /
translated: He is ‚Äúfixed in attention‚Äù because he is intent on all objects of meditation through the attention of the perception that is free from all conceptual elaboration and free from all distraction of the mind.

original: nang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma rnams la sems 'jog par byed pa dang / yang dag par 'jog par byed pa na /
analyzed: nang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma rnams la sems 'jog par byed pa dang / yang dag par 'jog par byed pa na /
translated: When he fixes his mind on the internal signs of concentration and fixes it properly,

original: rgyas par rgyud gcig tu byed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin du byed rtse gcig tu byed cing mnyam par 'jog pa 'di ni zhi gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par rgyud gcig tu byed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin du byed rtse gcig tu byed cing mnyam par 'jog pa 'di ni zhi gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: he makes the mind stream flow, he makes it one-pointed, he makes it concentrated, and he makes it even. This is called ‚Äúcalming.‚Äù

original: lhag mthong gang zhe na /
analyzed: lhag mthong gang zhe na /
translated: What is insight?

original: zhi gnas yongs su bsgom pa'i yid la byed pa de nyid kyis ji ltar bsam pa'i chos de dag nyid kyi mtshan ma yid la byed cing 'byed pa dang / rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa nas /
analyzed: zhi gnas yongs su bsgom pa'i yid la byed pa de nyid kyis ji ltar bsam pa'i chos de dag nyid kyi mtshan ma yid la byed cing 'byed pa dang / rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa nas /
translated: The attention that cultivates serenity is the attention that discerns the signs of those very phenomena that one has contemplated, that analyzes them, and that fully discerns them.üîΩIt is also the attention that is skilled in them, and that engages them with wisdom.

original: rgyas par mkhas pa dang / shes rab kyi 'jug pa'i bar gang yin @59b pa 'di ni lhag mthong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par mkhas pa dang / shes rab kyi 'jug pa'i bar gang yin @59b pa 'di ni lhag mthong zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called insight.

original: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong la goms pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong la goms pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the practice of serenity and insight?

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la rtag tu sbyor zhing gus par sbyor ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la rtag tu sbyor zhing gus par sbyor ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the constant and devoted practice of serenity and insight.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la mngon par dga' ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la mngon par dga' ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the delight in serenity and insight?

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mtshan ma de dag gnyis las sems mi g-yo la rang gi ngang gis mngon par 'du shes med par 'jug cing gnas pa dang / sdud cing mi 'phro ba gang yin pa 'di ni zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong la mngon par dga' ba zhes bya'o //üîΩde la byang chub sems dpa' ni ji lta ji ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la goms par byed pa de lta de ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la mngon par dga' bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mtshan ma de dag gnyis las sems mi g-yo la rang gi ngang gis mngon par 'du shes med par 'jug cing gnas pa dang / sdud cing mi 'phro ba gang yin pa 'di ni zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong la mngon par dga' ba zhes bya'o // de la byang chub sems dpa' ni ji lta ji ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la goms par byed pa de lta de ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la mngon par dga' bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: That which gathers in and does not proliferate is called delighting in ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ.üîΩThe bodhisattva, to the extent that he cultivates ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ, to that extent he abides in delighting in ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ.

original: ji lta ji ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la mngon par dga' bar gnas pa de lta de ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la mngon par dga' bar gnas pa de lta de ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: To the extent that he abides in delighting in ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ, to that extent ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ are purified.

original: ji lta ji ltar zhi gnas rnam par dag pa de lta de ltar lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa che ba dang / 'phel ba dang rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar zhi gnas rnam par dag pa de lta de ltar lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa che ba dang / 'phel ba dang rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The more pure the serenity, the more pure the physical and mental pliancy, the more extensive, the more increased, the more abundant.

original: ji lta ji ltar lhag mthong rnam par dag pa de lta de ltar ye shes mthong ba che ba dang 'phel ba dang rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar lhag mthong rnam par dag pa de lta de ltar ye shes mthong ba che ba dang 'phel ba dang rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The more pure the insight, the more pure the vision of wisdom, the more extensive, the more increased, the more abundant.

original: bsgom pa'i bya ba ni 'dir zad de /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i bya ba ni 'dir zad de /
translated: This is the extent of the activity of meditation.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: rten la yod pa'i gnas ngan len bsal bar bya ba dang / shes bya thams cad la yang ye shes mthong ba rnam par dag par bya ba ste /
analyzed: rten la yod pa'i gnas ngan len bsal bar bya ba dang / shes bya thams cad la yang ye shes mthong ba rnam par dag par bya ba ste /
translated: The elimination of the negative reflex actions that exist in the life- bases, and the purification of the vision of wisdom with regard to all objects of knowledge.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bsgom pa'i las de dag thams cad kyang bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi po 'dis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bsgom pa'i las de dag thams cad kyang bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi po 'dis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: All the activities of meditation of the bodhisattvas are accomplished by means of these four meditations.

original: gdams ngag gang zhe na /
analyzed: gdams ngag gang zhe na /
translated: What is counsel?

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be known as being of eight kinds:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gang dag la 'doms par 'dod pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gang dag la 'doms par 'dod pa'am /
translated: The bodhisattva who is to be instructed is either

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan nam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan nam /
translated: another bodhisattva,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de la 'doms par mdzad pa gang yang rung ste /üîΩdes thog ma nyid du ting nge 'dzin la brten tam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de la 'doms par mdzad pa gang yang rung ste / des thog ma nyid du ting nge 'dzin la brten tam /
translated: or the TathƒÅgata himself, who instructs him.üîΩFirst, he seeks the mind by means of concentration,

original: 'grogs pa'i rgyus sems btsal nas mkhyen to //üîΩsems btsal nas dbang po btsal te mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'grogs pa'i rgyus sems btsal nas mkhyen to // sems btsal nas dbang po btsal te mkhyen to //
translated: or by the cause of companionship.üîΩHaving sought the mind, he seeks the faculties and knows them.

original: dbang po btsal nas bsam pa btsal te mkhyen to //
analyzed: dbang po btsal nas bsam pa btsal te mkhyen to //
translated: Having sought the faculties, he seeks the inclinations and knows them.

original: bsam pa btsal nas bag la nyal btsal te mkhyen to //
analyzed: bsam pa btsal nas bag la nyal btsal te mkhyen to //
translated: Having sought the inclinations, he seeks the latent tendencies and knows them.üîΩHaving sought the latent tendencies, he introduces the disciple to the various doors of access, as is appropriate and suitable,

original: bag la nyal btsal nas ci rigs ci 'os par 'jug pa'i sgo sna tshogs dag tu yang na ni mi sdug pa @60a * //
analyzed: bag la nyal btsal nas ci rigs ci 'os par 'jug pa'i sgo sna tshogs dag tu yang na ni mi sdug pa @60a * //
translated: sometimes through foulness,

original: 'am ; yang na ni byams pa'am /
analyzed: 'am ; yang na ni byams pa'am /
translated: sometimes through loving kindness,

original: yang na ni rkyen 'di pa nyid kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: yang na ni rkyen 'di pa nyid kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'am /
translated: sometimes through dependent origination in terms of this very condition,

original: yang na ni khams rab tu dbye ba'am /
analyzed: yang na ni khams rab tu dbye ba'am /
translated: sometimes through the classification of the elements,

original: yang na ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dran pas 'dzud par mdzad do //
analyzed: yang na ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dran pas 'dzud par mdzad do //
translated: sometimes through mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation.

original: ci rigs ci 'os par 'jug pa'i sgo dag la btsud nas legs par bzung ba ma yin pa'i rtag pa'i mtha'i gnyen por dbu ma'i lam ston pa dang / legs par bzung ba ma yin pa'i chad pa'i mtha'i gnyen por dbu ma'i lam ston pa dang /
analyzed: ci rigs ci 'os par 'jug pa'i sgo dag la btsud nas legs par bzung ba ma yin pa'i rtag pa'i mtha'i gnyen por dbu ma'i lam ston pa dang / legs par bzung ba ma yin pa'i chad pa'i mtha'i gnyen por dbu ma'i lam ston pa dang /
translated: Having introduced them to the doors of entry that are suitable and appropriate, he teaches them the middle way as the antidote to the extreme of eternalism that is not well grasped, and he teaches them the middle way as the antidote to the extreme of annihilationism that is not well grasped.

original: ma byas pa la byas so snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal 'dor du gzhug pa dang / ma thob pa dang / ma rig pa dang / mngon sum du ma byas pa la mngon sum du byas so snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal 'dor du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: ma byas pa la byas so snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal 'dor du gzhug pa dang / ma thob pa dang / ma rig pa dang / mngon sum du ma byas pa la mngon sum du byas so snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal 'dor du 'jug pa'o //
translated: He causes them to abandon the overweening pride that thinks, ‚ÄúI have done what I have not done,‚Äù and he causes them to abandon the overweening pride that thinks, ‚ÄúI have obtained what I have not obtained,‚Äù ‚ÄúI have understood what I have not understood,‚Äù ‚ÄúI have realized what I have not realized,‚Äù and ‚ÄúI have actualized what I have not actualized.‚Äù

original: gdams ngag rnam pa brgyad po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na gnas gsum gyis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gdams ngag rnam pa brgyad po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na gnas gsum gyis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: These eight kinds of instruction should be understood as being included in three topics.

original: gnas gsum po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas gsum po dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three topics?

original: sems mi gnas pa gnas par bya ba'i phyir thog ma dmigs pa la legs par gtod pa dang / sems gnas pa la rang gi don thob par bya ba'i phyir thabs kyi lam yang dag par ston pa dang / rang gi don dgos pa mthar ma phyin pa la bar ma do'i gnas 'dor du 'jug pa'o //üîΩde la sems dang dbang po dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal shes pa dang / ci rigs pa shes pa sgor 'dzud pas ni sems gnas par bya ba'i phyir dmigs pa la sems legs par gtod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems mi gnas pa gnas par bya ba'i phyir thog ma dmigs pa la legs par gtod pa dang / sems gnas pa la rang gi don thob par bya ba'i phyir thabs kyi lam yang dag par ston pa dang / rang gi don dgos pa mthar ma phyin pa la bar ma do'i gnas 'dor du 'jug pa'o // de la sems dang dbang po dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal shes pa dang / ci rigs pa shes pa sgor 'dzud pas ni sems gnas par bya ba'i phyir dmigs pa la sems legs par gtod par rig par bya'o //
translated: In order to stabilize the unstable mind, he first properly directs the mind to the meditative object. In order to attain his own goal with a stabilized mind, he correctly teaches the path of means. He causes one to abandon the intermediate state when the purpose of one's own goal is not yet complete.üîΩAmong these, one should know that he properly directs the mind to the meditative object in order to stabilize the mind by knowing the mind, the faculties, the thoughts, the predispositions, and by introducing the person to the door of the path that is suitable for him.

original: de la legs par bzung ba ma yin pa'i rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha'i gnyen por dbu ma'i lam gyis ni sems gnas pa'i rang gi don thob par bya ba'i phyir thabs kyi lam yang dag par ston pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la legs par bzung ba ma yin pa'i rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha'i gnyen por dbu ma'i lam gyis ni sems gnas pa'i rang gi don thob par bya ba'i phyir thabs kyi lam yang dag par ston pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Among these, one should know that he correctly teaches the path of means in order to attain his own goal with a stabilized mind, by means of the middle way, which is the antidote to the extremes of eternalism and nihilism that are not well grasped.

original: de la ma byas pa nas mngon sum du ma byas pa'i bar dag la mngon sum du byas so snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal 'dor du bcug pas ni rang gi dgos pa mthar ma phyin pa'i bar ma do'i gnas yongs su spong bar rig par bya ste
analyzed: de la ma byas pa nas mngon sum du ma byas pa'i bar dag la mngon sum du byas so snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal 'dor du bcug pas ni rang gi dgos pa mthar ma phyin pa'i bar ma do'i gnas yongs su spong bar rig par bya ste
translated: One should understand that from not having done up to not having actualized, the abandonment of the over-esteeming of non-virtue is the complete abandonment of the state of the middle way until one's purpose is fulfilled.

original: / de ltar na gnas gsum po 'di dag gis gdams ngag rnam pa brgyad po bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: / de ltar na gnas gsum po 'di dag gis gdams ngag rnam pa brgyad po bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' gdams ngag gzhan las thos pa'am /

translated: The five powers are the power of knowing the various elements, the power of knowing the paths that lead everywhere, the power of knowing the recollection of past lives, the power of knowing death and rebirth, and the power of knowing the extinction of the outflows.

original: de la rjes su bstan pa gang zhe na /
