analyzed: yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po 'dres pa'i sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva‚Äôs generosity of mixing inner and outer things.

original: ji skad smos pa 'di la ma gtogs pa'i lhag ma'i sbyin pa bya ba'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba ni phyi rol gyi sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba kho na zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: ji skad smos pa 'di la ma gtogs pa'i lhag ma'i sbyin pa bya ba'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba ni phyi rol gyi sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba kho na zhes bya'o ;
translated: The giving of the remaining things to be given, which are not included in the above description, is called the giving of outer things to be given.

original: ; de la byang chub sems dpa' ni pha rol 'dod pa dag la mdor na rnam pa gnyis kyis rang gi lus sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: ; de la byang chub sems dpa' ni pha rol 'dod pa dag la mdor na rnam pa gnyis kyis rang gi lus sbyin par byed de /
translated: In brief, the bodhisattva gives his own body to others in two ways, in order to fulfill the wishes of others.

original: ci dga' mgur byed du 'jug pas gzhan la dbang yod pa dang / gzhan la rag las par byed cing bdag nyid gzhan dag la sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: ci dga' mgur byed du 'jug pas gzhan la dbang yod pa dang / gzhan la rag las par byed cing bdag nyid gzhan dag la sbyin par byed do //
translated: He gives himself to others, making himself subject to the will of others, so that they can do with him as they wish, and so that he can be controlled by others.

original: dper na la la zhig zas dang skom gyi phyir gzhan dag la bran gyi dngos por khas len pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na la la zhig zas dang skom gyi phyir gzhan dag la bran gyi dngos por khas len pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, someone might offer himself into slavery to others for the sake of food and drink.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zang zing med pa'i sems dang ldan pa yang byang chub dam pa 'dod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zang zing med pa'i sems dang ldan pa yang byang chub dam pa 'dod do //
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva, with a disinterested mind, desires the highest enlightenment.

original: pha rol la phan pa dang / bde bar bya bar 'dod /
analyzed: pha rol la phan pa dang / bde bar bya bar 'dod /
translated: He desires to benefit and bring happiness to others.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'dod de /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'dod de /
translated: He desires to perfect the perfection of generosity.

original: ci dga' mgur byed du 'jug pas gzhan dag la dbang yod pa dang / rag lus par byed cing /
analyzed: ci dga' mgur byed du 'jug pas gzhan dag la dbang yod pa dang / rag lus par byed cing /
translated: He makes others independent and free, allowing them to do whatever they want.

original: bdag nyid sbyin par byed pa dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / mig dang / mgo bo dang / yan lag dang / nying lag rnams 'dod pa dag dang / sha dang / khrag dang / rgyus pa 'dod pa dang / rkang gi bar du 'dod pa dag la rkang gi bar du sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: bdag nyid sbyin par byed pa dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / mig dang / mgo bo dang / yan lag dang / nying lag rnams 'dod pa dag dang / sha dang / khrag dang / rgyus pa 'dod pa dang / rkang gi bar du 'dod pa dag la rkang gi bar du sbyin par byed do //
translated: He gives to those who desire his body, his hands, his feet, his eyes, his head, his limbs, his minor parts, his flesh, his blood, his sinews, and even to his bones, giving even to the marrow of his bones.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam pa gnyis kyis phyi rol gyi dngos po sems can la yongs su gtong ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam pa gnyis kyis phyi rol gyi dngos po sems can la yongs su gtong ste /
translated: The bodhisattva gives external things to sentient beings in two ways.

original: ci bder longs spyod du gzhug pa'i phyir brnyan por sbyin pa dang / de dbang bar bya ba'i phyir thams cad kyi thams cad du gtong pa'i sems kyis sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: ci bder longs spyod du gzhug pa'i phyir brnyan por sbyin pa dang / de dbang bar bya ba'i phyir thams cad kyi thams cad du gtong pa'i sems kyis sbyin par byed do //
translated: He gives them as a loan, so that they may enjoy them as they wish, and he gives them with the intention of their becoming owners, giving them so that they will be completely theirs.

original: 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' ni nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po thams cad bye brag med par rnam pa thams cad du sems can rnams la sbyin par ni mi byed do //üîΩ'o na byang chub sems dpa' ni nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po rnam pa gnyis las ci zhig na sems can rnams la sbyin par byed /
analyzed: 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' ni nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po thams cad bye brag med par rnam pa thams cad du sems can rnams la sbyin par ni mi byed do // 'o na byang chub sems dpa' ni nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po rnam pa gnyis las ci zhig na sems can rnams la sbyin par byed /
translated: However, the bodhisattva does not give sentient beings everything, both internal and external things, in every way, without making distinctions.

original: ci zhig ni sbyin par mi byed /üîΩji ltar na sbyin par byed /
analyzed: ci zhig ni sbyin par mi byed / ji ltar na sbyin par byed /
translated: Well then, from among the two kinds of things, internal and external, what does the bodhisattva give to sentient beings and what does he not give?

original: ji ltar na sbyin par mi byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyin par mi byed ce na /
translated: How does he give and how does he not give?

original: nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po de las sbyin pa gang sems can rnams la bde ba kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po de las sbyin pa gang sems can rnams la bde ba kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: The bodhisattva does not give to others that inner and outer thing whose giving would only bring happiness to sentient beings,

original: phan par mi 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: phan par mi 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: but not benefit,

original: yang na bde bar mi 'gyur @62b la ;üîΩphan par yang mi 'gyur pa de ni byang chub sems dpas gzhan dag la sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: yang na bde bar mi 'gyur @62b la ; phan par yang mi 'gyur pa de ni byang chub sems dpas gzhan dag la sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: or which would not bring happinessüîΩor benefit.

original: sbyin pa gang phan par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: sbyin pa gang phan par mi 'gyur la /
translated: The bodhisattva does give to others that giving which would bring benefit,

original: bde bar 'gyur ba ni ma nges pa'am /
analyzed: bde bar 'gyur ba ni ma nges pa'am /
translated: but not happiness, which is uncertain,

original: yang na bde bar yang 'gyur la phan par yang 'gyur ba de ni byang chub sems dpas gzhan dag la sbyin par byed do ;
analyzed: yang na bde bar yang 'gyur la phan par yang 'gyur ba de ni byang chub sems dpas gzhan dag la sbyin par byed do ;
translated: or which would bring happiness and benefit.

original: ; de ltar 'di ni sbyin pa dang / mi sbyin pa'i mdor bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ; de ltar 'di ni sbyin pa dang / mi sbyin pa'i mdor bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus this is the brief presentation of giving and not giving.

original: 'di man chad ni rgyas par rnam par dbye ba yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni rgyas par rnam par dbye ba yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: From here on, it should be understood as the detailed analysis.

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni pha rol la gnod par bya ba dang / pha rol brid pa dang / mi rigs pas bskyed pas byed du bcug na pha rol dbang yod pa dang / pha rol la rag las par byed par bdag nyid sbyin par mi byed de /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni pha rol la gnod par bya ba dang / pha rol brid pa dang / mi rigs pas bskyed pas byed du bcug na pha rol dbang yod pa dang / pha rol la rag las par byed par bdag nyid sbyin par mi byed de /
translated: Here, bodhisattvas do not give themselves to others to be harmed, to be deceived, or to be made to commit an unwholesome action, if the other person is powerful and the bodhisattva is not dependent on that person.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan dag la bdag nyid kyi srog lan brgya'am /üîΩlan stong ngam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan dag la bdag nyid kyi srog lan brgya'am / lan stong ngam /
translated: Bodhisattvas would even agree to give their own lives to others hundreds of times,üîΩthousands of times,

original: lan 'bum du yongs su gtong bar yang khas len mod kyi /üîΩ'on kyang pha rol gyis bsgo ba dang ; pha rol dga' bar bya ba'i phyir pha rol la gnod pa'am /üîΩpha rol gsod pa'am /
analyzed: lan 'bum du yongs su gtong bar yang khas len mod kyi / 'on kyang pha rol gyis bsgo ba dang ; pha rol dga' bar bya ba'i phyir pha rol la gnod pa'am / pha rol gsod pa'am /
translated: hundreds of thousands of times.üîΩHowever, they do not harm others,üîΩkill others,

original: pha rol 'drid par mi byed do //üîΩgal te byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: pha rol 'drid par mi byed do // gal te byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa las brtsams te /
translated: or deceive others in order to please others or to do what others want.

original: bsam pa dag pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: bsam pa dag pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: If bodhisattvas, even though their intention is pure,

original: de yang sems can gyi don mang po bya ba nye bar gnas par gyur na rang gi lus dang / yan lag dang nyid lag slong ba byung yang /
analyzed: de yang sems can gyi don mang po bya ba nye bar gnas par gyur na rang gi lus dang / yan lag dang nyid lag slong ba byung yang /
translated: Moreover, when many benefits for sentient beings are at stake, even if someone asks for his body,

original: rang gi lus dang yan lag dang nying lag rnams sbyin par mi byed de /
analyzed: rang gi lus dang yan lag dang nying lag rnams sbyin par mi byed de /
translated: his major and minor body parts, he does not give them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa las brtsams te bsam pa dag pa de ni rnam grangs gang gis kyang 'di ni sbyin no //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa las brtsams te bsam pa dag pa de ni rnam grangs gang gis kyang 'di ni sbyin no //
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ni mi sbyin no snyam du sems zhum pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ni mi sbyin no snyam du sems zhum pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the bodhisattva, beginning with generosity, has a pure intention. He does not think in any way, ‚ÄúI will give this, but I will not give that.‚ÄùüîΩHis mind is not depressed.

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' de ni gang gi tshe bsam pa dag par bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩsems can gyi dgos pa 'byung ba btang snyoms su byas te sbyin par mi byed na /
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' de ni gang gi tshe bsam pa dag par bya ba'i phyir ro // sems can gyi dgos pa 'byung ba btang snyoms su byas te sbyin par mi byed na /
translated: Therefore, when the bodhisattva is purifying his intention,üîΩhe does not give out of indifference to the needs of sentient beings that have arisen.

original: de ni de'i bsam pa dag pa yin pa'i phyir sems can gyi dgos pa byung ba btang snyoms su byas te sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: de ni de'i bsam pa dag pa yin pa'i phyir sems can gyi dgos pa byung ba btang snyoms su byas te sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: Because he has a pure intention, he does not give out of indifference to the needs of sentient beings that have arisen.

original: bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams la ji ltar tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pas slod du 'ong ba rnams la yang de dag nyid la gnod pa dang / phung ba chen por mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams la ji ltar tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pas slod du 'ong ba rnams la yang de dag nyid la gnod pa dang / phung ba chen por mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: He does not give away his body or limbs, even to those who are asking for them, in order to harm or destroy those gods of the Mara class who are intent on harming.

original: rang gi lus dang yan lag gse zhing sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: rang gi lus dang yan lag gse zhing sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: He does not give away his body or limbs even to the insane or to those whose minds are disturbed.

original: @63a * // bdud kyi rigs kyi lha rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du des byin gyis rlobs pa'i sems can rnams la yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: @63a * // bdud kyi rigs kyi lha rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du des byin gyis rlobs pa'i sems can rnams la yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be understood as like the gods of the Mara class.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni smyos pa dang / sems 'khrug pa rnams la yang rang gi lus dang yan lag gse zhing sbyin par mi byed do ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni smyos pa dang / sems 'khrug pa rnams la yang rang gi lus dang yan lag gse zhing sbyin par mi byed do ;
translated: He does not give away his body or limbs even to the insane or to those whose minds are disturbed.

original: / de dag ni rang gi sems la gnas pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: / de dag ni rang gi sems la gnas pa yang ma yin la /
translated: They are not in their right minds.

original: 'dod pa'i phyir slong ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i phyir slong ba yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not asking out of desire.

original: de ni de dag gi sems la rang dbang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni de dag gi sems la rang dbang med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they have no control over their minds,

original: brla rdol tsam du zad pas de'i phyir sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: brla rdol tsam du zad pas de'i phyir sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: he does not give to them, for they are like a wound in the thigh.

original: rnam pa de dag la ma gtogs par de las bzlog pa'i 'dod pa rnams la ni byang chub sems dpas rang gi lus pha rol dbang bar byas pa tsam gyi phyir ram /
analyzed: rnam pa de dag la ma gtogs par de las bzlog pa'i 'dod pa rnams la ni byang chub sems dpas rang gi lus pha rol dbang bar byas pa tsam gyi phyir ram /
translated: Apart from these aspects, bodhisattvas do not have the opposite kind of wishes, because they have made their bodies subject to others.

original: yan lag dang nyid lag gse zhing yongs su gtong bar yang byed do //
analyzed: yan lag dang nyid lag gse zhing yongs su gtong bar yang byed do //
translated: Apart from these, the bodhisattva does not give away his own body to others, nor does he give away his limbs and parts.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i nang gi dngos po sbyin pa dang / mi sbyin pa ni de lta bu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i nang gi dngos po sbyin pa dang / mi sbyin pa ni de lta bu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is how the bodhisattva should be known to give internally and not to give internally.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po las ni byang chub sems dpas dug dang / me dang / mtshon cha dang / chang sems can rnams la gnod par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag la gnod par bya ba'am /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po las ni byang chub sems dpas dug dang / me dang / mtshon cha dang / chang sems can rnams la gnod par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag la gnod par bya ba'am /
translated: As for external things, the bodhisattva does not give poison, fire, weapons, or intoxicants to sentient beings if they are harmful.

original: pha rol la gnod par bya ba'i phyir 'dod de slong na /
analyzed: pha rol la gnod par bya ba'i phyir 'dod de slong na /
translated: If someone asks for these with the intention of harming himself or others,

original: slong ba rnams la sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: slong ba rnams la sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: the bodhisattva does not give them to the person who asks.

original: dug dang / me dang / mtshon cha dang / chang sems can rnams la phan par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpas bdag la phan par bya ba 'am /
analyzed: dug dang / me dang / mtshon cha dang / chang sems can rnams la phan par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpas bdag la phan par bya ba 'am /
translated: The bodhisattva gives these to others if they are beneficial to oneself or

original: pha rol la phan par bya ba'i phyir 'dod de /üîΩslong na slong ba rnams la sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: pha rol la phan par bya ba'i phyir 'dod de / slong na slong ba rnams la sbyin par byed do //
translated: if they are beneficial to others.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni pha rol yid brtan pa ma yin pa'i rdzas kyang gzhan dag la sbyin par mi byed do //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' ni smyan byed cing pha rol gyi chung ma bkug ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni pha rol yid brtan pa ma yin pa'i rdzas kyang gzhan dag la sbyin par mi byed do // byang chub sems dpa' ni smyan byed cing pha rol gyi chung ma bkug ste /
translated: The bodhisattva does not give to petitioners things that are untrustworthy.

original: gzhan dag la yang sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva does not give to others the wife or children who are his own dependents, nor does he give them to others as prostitutes.

original: bza' ba dang btung ba srog chags dang bcas pa yang sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung ba srog chags dang bcas pa yang sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva does not give food or drink that contains living beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po gang dga' ba dang / rtse ba dang ldan pa sems can rnams la gnod pa dang ldan pa de yang byang chub sems dpas slong ba rnams la sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po gang dga' ba dang / rtse ba dang ldan pa sems can rnams la gnod pa dang ldan pa de yang byang chub sems dpas slong ba rnams la sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva does not give to petitioners any object that is to be given which is connected with pleasure and amusement, and which is connected with harm to sentient beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de byin na de dag byang chub sems dpa' la sems dga' ba tsam skye bar 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de byin na de dag byang chub sems dpa' la sems dga' ba tsam skye bar 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: Because, although that gift would produce only a slight joy in the bodhisattva,

original: 'on kyang sbyin pa de ni de la @63b gnod pa ches che bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang sbyin pa de ni de la @63b gnod pa ches che bar byed pa yin te /
translated: nevertheless, that gift would cause great harm to the recipient.

original: de'i rgyus da dag rgyags pa dang / bag med pa dang / nyes pa spyod pa la zhugs pas lus zhig nas ngan song dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyus da dag rgyags pa dang / bag med pa dang / nyes pa spyod pa la zhugs pas lus zhig nas ngan song dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, on account of that, they would become intoxicated, careless, and engaged in misconduct, and after the breakup of the body, they would be reborn in a bad destination.

original: gal te dga' ba dang / rtsed mo la sogs pa'i dngos po yin la /
analyzed: gal te dga' ba dang / rtsed mo la sogs pa'i dngos po yin la /
translated: If the object is connected with pleasure and amusement,

original: ngan song dag tu 'gro bar byed pa yang ma yin mi dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs par 'gyur ba yang ma yin na ni /
analyzed: ngan song dag tu 'gro bar byed pa yang ma yin mi dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs par 'gyur ba yang ma yin na ni /
translated: but does not cause one to go to a bad destination, and does not cause one to engage in the roots of unwholesomeness,

original: de lta bu'i dga' ba dang rtsed mo la sogs pa'i dngos po de sems dga' bar bya ba'i phyir slong ba rnams la sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: de lta bu'i dga' ba dang rtsed mo la sogs pa'i dngos po de sems dga' bar bya ba'i phyir slong ba rnams la sbyin par byed de /
translated: He gives to petitioners those things that are the causes of joy, such as amusements and games, in order to gladden their minds.

original: dngos po des kyang sdud pa dang / yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po des kyang sdud pa dang / yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And he attracts and ripens them by means of those things.

original: byang chub sems dpa' slong ba rnams la dga' ba dang / rtsed mo'i dngos po ji lta bu ni sbyin par mi byed /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' slong ba rnams la dga' ba dang / rtsed mo'i dngos po ji lta bu ni sbyin par mi byed /
translated: What kinds of things that are the causes of joy and games does the bodhisattva not give to petitioners?

original: ji lta bu ni sbyin par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bu ni sbyin par byed ce na /
translated: What kinds does he give?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: He does not give the following:

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni ri dags bsad pa'i thabs bslab pa sbyin par mi byed do //üîΩmchod sbyin ngan pa yo lang chen por gang du srog chags mang po bsags nas gsod par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i mchod sbyin dag bdag nyid kyang mi byed la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni ri dags bsad pa'i thabs bslab pa sbyin par mi byed do // mchod sbyin ngan pa yo lang chen por gang du srog chags mang po bsags nas gsod par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i mchod sbyin dag bdag nyid kyang mi byed la /
translated: The bodhisattva does not give the training in the methods of killing wild animals.

original: gzhan dag kyang mchod sbyin byed du mi 'jug go //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang mchod sbyin byed du mi 'jug go //
translated: He does not himself perform or cause others to perform the kind of sacrifice at which many living beings are slaughtered and destroyed.

original: lha rten rnams su phyugs gsod pa sbyin par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: lha rten rnams su phyugs gsod pa sbyin par yang mi byed do //
translated: He does not give the killing of cattle at the shrines.

original: srog chags mang po gnas pa'i sa phyogs srog chags chu nas skyes pa'am /üîΩskom las skyes pa rnams gnas pa lta bu srog chags de dag la gnod par bya ba'i phyir slong na sbyin par mi byed do //üîΩrgya dang rngon gyi 'khrul 'khor dang / rgya dang rngon gyi 'khrul 'khor bslab pa yang srog chags rnams la gnod par bya ba'i phyir slong na sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: srog chags mang po gnas pa'i sa phyogs srog chags chu nas skyes pa'am / skom las skyes pa rnams gnas pa lta bu srog chags de dag la gnod par bya ba'i phyir slong na sbyin par mi byed do // rgya dang rngon gyi 'khrul 'khor dang / rgya dang rngon gyi 'khrul 'khor bslab pa yang srog chags rnams la gnod par bya ba'i phyir slong na sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: One should not give to those who ask for the purpose of harming living beings, such as to those who want to catch and kill fish, birds, deer, etc.üîΩOne should not give to those who ask for the purpose of harming living beings, such as to those who want to catch and kill fish, birds, deer, etc.üîΩOne should not give to those who ask for the purpose of harming living beings, such as to those who want to catch and kill fish, birds, deer, etc.

original: spyo ba dang / gsod pa dang / bcing ba dang / chad pas bcad pa dang / gnod pa byed du gzhug pa'i phyir yang dgra rnams kyi dgra sbyin par mi byed de /

translated: One should not give to enemies for the purpose of insulting, killing, binding, punishing, or harming them.

original: mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams kyi dga' ba dang / rtsed mo'i dngos po sems can pha rol la gnod par 'gyur ba dang / sems can pha rol la sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad slong ba rnams la sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams kyi dga' ba dang / rtsed mo'i dngos po sems can pha rol la gnod par 'gyur ba dang / sems can pha rol la sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad slong ba rnams la sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: In brief, the bodhisattva does not give to petitioners any object of joy or play that would harm other sentient beings or cause suffering to other sentient beings.

original: glang po che dang / rta dang / shing rta dang / 'deg  pa dang / bzhon pa rnams dang / gos dang rgyan rnams dang / bza' ba dang / btung @64a * //
analyzed: glang po che dang / rta dang / shing rta dang / 'deg  pa dang / bzhon pa rnams dang / gos dang rgyan rnams dang / bza' ba dang / btung @64a * //
translated: He does not give elephants, horses, chariots, vehicles, conveyances, clothes, ornaments, food, drink,

original: ba dang ; bsod pa rnams dang / gar dang / glu dang / rol mo'i sgra bslab pa rnams dang / gar dang / glu dang / rol mo'i sgra'i cha byad rnams dang / spos dang / me tog phreng ba dang / byug pa sna tshogs dang /
analyzed: ba dang ; bsod pa rnams dang / gar dang / glu dang / rol mo'i sgra bslab pa rnams dang / gar dang / glu dang / rol mo'i sgra'i cha byad rnams dang / spos dang / me tog phreng ba dang / byug pa sna tshogs dang /

original: snod spyad sna tshogs dang / skyed mos tshal dang / khang khyim dang / dga' mgur spyod pa'i bud med rnams dang / bzo dang las kyi gnas rnam pa sna tshogs bslab pa gang yin pa de dag dang / de lta bu'i dga' ba dang /
analyzed: snod spyad sna tshogs dang / skyed mos tshal dang / khang khyim dang / dga' mgur spyod pa'i bud med rnams dang / bzo dang las kyi gnas rnam pa sna tshogs bslab pa gang yin pa de dag dang / de lta bu'i dga' ba dang /
translated: Whatever various vessels, parks, houses, women for sexual enjoyment, and various arts and occupations he has trained in,

original: rtse mo'i dngos po gang yin pa rnams ni byang chub sems dpas sems dga' bar bya ba'i phyir slong ba rnams la sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: rtse mo'i dngos po gang yin pa rnams ni byang chub sems dpas sems dga' bar bya ba'i phyir slong ba rnams la sbyin par byed do //
translated: whatever things are the basis for such joy and play, the bodhisattva gives them to beggars in order to delight their minds.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni nad pa slong du zin kyang kha zas dang btung ba tshod ma zin pa'am gnod par 'gyur ba sbyin par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni nad pa slong du zin kyang kha zas dang btung ba tshod ma zin pa'am gnod par 'gyur ba sbyin par yang mi byed do //
translated: Even if a bodhisattva is sick, he or she does not give food and drink that is not suitable or that is harmful.

original: sems can brkam pa'i rang bzhin can 'brangs pa rnams la bza' ba dang btung ba bsod pa sbyin par yang mi byed do//üîΩsems can mya ngan gyis gdung ba rnams rang 'geg par byed pa'am /
analyzed: sems can brkam pa'i rang bzhin can 'brangs pa rnams la bza' ba dang btung ba bsod pa sbyin par yang mi byed do// sems can mya ngan gyis gdung ba rnams rang 'geg par byed pa'am /
translated: He or she does not give good food and drink to greedy people who are attached.üîΩHe or she does not give poison to those who are tormented by grief,üîΩwho are intent on killing themselves,üîΩwho are intent on beating themselves,

original: rdeg par byed pa'am dug 'thung ba'am /
analyzed: rdeg par byed pa'am dug 'thung ba'am /
translated: or who are intent on hanging themselves.

original: g-yang du mchong ba la yang dga' ma gur byed du mi 'jug go //üîΩ/ bam po bdun pa /
analyzed: g-yang du mchong ba la yang dga' ma gur byed du mi 'jug go // / bam po bdun pa /
translated: He does not even allow himself to be happy when he jumps off a cliff.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba rnams la pha ma thams cad kyi thams cad du sbyin par yang mi byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba rnams la pha ma thams cad kyi thams cad du sbyin par yang mi byed de /
translated: The bodhisattva does not give away his parents to beggars,

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i pha ma ni bla ma lta bu mchog yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i pha ma ni bla ma lta bu mchog yin te /
translated: because the parents of the bodhisattva are the most venerable of all.

original: nu ma snun pa dang / gso ba dang / skyed pa yin pas de'i phyir byang chub sems dpas yun ring por spyi bo la khyer na yang skyo bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: nu ma snun pa dang / gso ba dang / skyed pa yin pas de'i phyir byang chub sems dpas yun ring por spyi bo la khyer na yang skyo bar mi bya ste /
translated: They are the ones who nursed him, raised him, and cared for him. Therefore, the bodhisattva should not be distressed even if he is carried off by the head for a long time.

original: spu gta' dang / gtar gzhug pa dang ; btsong ba'i tshul gyis bdag nyid de gnyis la sbyin zhing dbang ba dang / rag lus par bya ba yin na /üîΩbyang chub sems dpas gzhan dag la sbyin par ji ltar sems te /
analyzed: spu gta' dang / gtar gzhug pa dang ; btsong ba'i tshul gyis bdag nyid de gnyis la sbyin zhing dbang ba dang / rag lus par bya ba yin na / byang chub sems dpas gzhan dag la sbyin par ji ltar sems te /
translated: If he should give himself to them as a slave, as a pledge, as a purchased commodity,üîΩhow could the bodhisattva think of giving them away to others?

original: sbyin par lta ga la byed /
analyzed: sbyin par lta ga la byed /
translated: How could he even consider it?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rgyal po spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i bdag por gyur na yang bdag gis ris su gtogs pa'i sems can yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi gzhan gyi bu dang chung ma gzhan dag las phrogs te /

translated: When a bodhisattva becomes a king anointed on the head, he does not take the wives and children of others who belong to his realm and are under his protection.üîΩ

original: gzhan dag la sbyin par mi byed kyi /üîΩnga la ji ltar gyur pa ltar de dag la'ang de bzhin du gyur cig snyam nas grong ril po 'am /üîΩgrong gi @64b phyogs 'ga'am /üîΩljongs ril po'am /

analyzed: ljongs kyi phyogs 'ga' longs spyod du bya bar sbyin par zad do //

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag gi bu'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag gi bu'am /

original: chung ma dang / bran dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba dang / yongs su zin pa rnams legs par brda ma sprad pa'am /
analyzed: chung ma dang / bran dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba dang / yongs su zin pa rnams legs par brda ma sprad pa'am /

analyzed: mtshungs pa'am lhag pa kho nar byed do //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni dngos po bzang po sbyin par dam bcas na /

analyzed: ngan pa dang tha chad sbyin par mi byed de /

analyzed: bzang po yod na bzang po 'ba' zhig sbyin par byed do //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni yid mi dga' ba dang / khros pa dang / yid 'khrugs pas sbyin pa sbyin par yang mi byed do //

original: bskyed do zhe'am /
analyzed: bskyed do zhe'am /

original: drangs so zhes smod par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: drangs so zhes smod par yang mi byed do //
translated: I brought it.‚Äù

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni mi ngan pa la sbyin pa byin na yang brnyas shing ma gus par sbyin pa sbyin par yang mi byed na yon tan can la lta ci smos /
translated: Even when bodhisattvas give to evil people, they do not give with contempt or disrespect, much less to those who have good qualities.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba po log par bsgrub pa rnam pa sna tshogs dag la gnas pa /

original: rgod pa bdag nyid ma bsdams pa /
analyzed: rgod pa bdag nyid ma bsdams pa /

original: gshe ba / khro ba spyod 'dems byed pa rnams kyi log par sgrub pas skyo ba'i yid kyis sbyin par sbyin par yang mi byed kyi /
analyzed: gshe ba / khro ba spyod 'dems byed pa rnams kyi log par sgrub pas skyo ba'i yid kyis sbyin par sbyin par yang mi byed kyi /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de dag nyid la shas cher nyon mongs pas brlams pa'i rang bzhin can yin par rtogs nas /
translated: But bodhisattvas, realizing that these very people are overwhelmed by their afflictions,

original: snying brtse ba'i sems kho na nye bar gzhag ste /
analyzed: snying brtse ba'i sems kho na nye bar gzhag ste /
translated: establish themselves in a compassionate state of mind

original: sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //

analyzed: lta ba ngan pa mchog tu 'dzin cing sbyin pa sbyin par yang mi byed do //
translated: They do not give gifts to those who hold bad views and consider them to be supreme.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is the way it is.

original: gnod pa chen po'i mchod sbyin rnams dang / 'tshe ba'i sbyin pas chos su 'gyur bar mi 'dzin pa dang / dge mtshan dang bkra shis dang sbyar te /

original: sbyin pa sbyin par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa sbyin par yang mi byed do //
translated: He does not give gifts in connection with good omens and auspicious moments.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi sbyin pa tsam shin tu rnam par dag pas kyang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnam par dag par 'gyur bar yang mi 'dzin @65b te ;

translated: He does not consider that the mere giving of gifts in all circumstances is a pure cause of mundane and supramundane freedom from attachment.

analyzed: sbyin pa ni rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i tshogs tsam 'ba' zhig yin par 'dzin to //
translated: He considers that it is only a collection that is a pure cause of freedom from attachment.

original: 'bras bu la lta zhing sbyin par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: 'bras bu la lta zhing sbyin par yang mi byed do //

translated: When bodhisattvas have objects to give and a beggar has properly appeared, if their minds do not turn to generosity, they quickly realize with their wisdom that the fault is their lack of prior habituation and think,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpas zhen pa las gyur pa'i nyes pa de myur ba myur bar shes rab kyis rtogs nas bdag sdug bsngal la bde'o snyam du bdag gi 'du shes phyin ci log pa 'di ni phyi ma la sdug bsngal bskyed pa yin no snyam du phyin ci

analyzed: log tu yongs su shes nas /

analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' gal te sbyin pa byin nas sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen po'i phan yon la lta bar gyur te /

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi phan yon la mi lta bar gyur na /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' log pa'i 'bras bu la lta ba las gyur pa'i nyes pa de myur ba myur bar shes rab kyis rtogs nas /

analyzed: 'du byed thams cad snying po med pa nyid du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtogs te /

original: 'du byed thams cad ni skad cig la 'ji @71a * //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni skad cig la 'ji @71a * //

analyzed: 'jig pa'i ngang can dang bral bas 'jig pa'i ngang can no snyam ste /

analyzed: de de ltar so sor rtog pa na 'bras bu la lta ba spangs nas sbyin pa gang ci yang rung ste /

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la gegs byed pa rnam pa bzhi dang / sbyin pa la gegs byed pa'i gnyen po rnam pa bzhi shes pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la gegs byed pa rnam pa bzhi dang / sbyin pa la gegs byed pa'i gnyen po rnam pa bzhi shes pa yin par rig par bya ste /

analyzed: rtogs pa dang / sdug bsngal dang du len pa dang / phyin ci log yongs su shes pa dang ; 'du byed la snying po med pa nyid du lta ba'o //
translated: realization, the acceptance of suffering, the full understanding of error, and the view of the lack of any real essence in conditioned things.

analyzed: de la gnyen po shes pa snga ma rnam pa gsum gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' nges pa dang / legs par sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //

analyzed: gnyen po shes pa tha ma gcig gis ni yang dag pa'i bsod nams kyi 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin par byed de /

analyzed: nang du bsdus nas bsam pa dag cing snying thag pa nas dang bas kun tu rtog pa dag gis sbyin par bya ba'i chos rnam pa sna tshogs pa rgya chen po dpag tu med pa dag mos shing sems can rnams sbyin pa stobs par 'dod do //

original: 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' shes rab can gyi sbyin pa yin par rig par bya'o//
analyzed: 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' shes rab can gyi sbyin pa yin par rig par bya'o//

translated: It is based on the analytical knowledges, on generosity of superior intention, on the knowledge that remedies the obstacles to generosity and on the generosity of superior intention that is inspired.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kho na'i ma 'dres pa yin par rig par bya @71b ste ;

translated: The stain of hoarding should be understood as the relinquishment of the grasping of enjoyments.

original: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa @72b ni seng ge dang / stag dang / chu srin 'dzin khri dang / rgyal po dang / chom rkun dang / chu la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa las yongs su skyob pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa @72b ni seng ge dang / stag dang / chu srin 'dzin khri dang / rgyal po dang / chom rkun dang / chu la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa las yongs su skyob pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The giving of fearlessness should be understood as the protection from fear of lions, tigers, hyenas, kings, robbers, water, etc.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa ni phyin ci ma log par chos ston pa dang / rigs par chos ston pa dang / bslab pa'i gzhi yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa ni phyin ci ma log par chos ston pa dang / rigs par chos ston pa dang / bslab pa'i gzhi yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa ste /
translated: The giving of Dharma is the teaching of the Dharma without error, the teaching of the Dharma in a reasonable manner, and the engagement in the taking up of the bases of training.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i rnam pa dgu po de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i rnam pa dgu po de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni /
translated: All of these nine aspects of generosity of the bodhisattvas, when taken together,

original: sems can rnams kyi 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: are for the happiness of beings in this life and in the next.

original: de la zang zing dang / mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa ni tshe 'di'i bde ba'o//
analyzed: de la zang zing dang / mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa ni tshe 'di'i bde ba'o//
translated: Among them, the generosity of material things and the generosity of fearlessness, together with their analysis, are for the happiness of beings in this life.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa gang rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa ni gzhan na bde ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa gang rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa ni gzhan na bde ba'o //
translated: The generosity of the teaching, together with its analysis, is for the happiness of beings in the next life.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the pure generosity of the bodhisattvas?

original: de ni rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as being of ten kinds:

original: thogs pa med pa dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa dang / bsags pa med pa dang / khengs pa med pa dang / mi brten pa dang / zhum pa med pa dang / ngan pa ma yin pa dang / rgyab kyis phyogs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa dang / bsags pa med pa dang / khengs pa med pa dang / mi brten pa dang / zhum pa med pa dang / ngan pa ma yin pa dang / rgyab kyis phyogs pa med pa dang /
translated: unimpeded, unattached, not stored up, not inflated, not dependent, not depressed, not low, not turned away,

original: lan la mi lta ba dang / rnam par smin pa la mi lta ba'o //
analyzed: lan la mi lta ba dang / rnam par smin pa la mi lta ba'o //
translated: not looking for rewards, and not looking for evolutionary development.

original: de la thogs pa med pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la thogs pa med pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is generosity without obstruction?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba po legs par 'ongs nas mi skyo bar la gor du skyen par sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba po legs par 'ongs nas mi skyo bar la gor du skyen par sbyin par byed de /
translated: Here a bodhisattva, when a petitioner has come, gives quickly and without delay, without being sullen.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di ltar sbyin pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di ltar sbyin pa las brtsams te /
translated: A bodhisattva does not give in this way:

original: skyen du byed pa lta bur ni slong ba pos rnyed pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: skyen du byed pa lta bur ni slong ba pos rnyed pa las brtsams te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe petitioner is not quick to give, having begun with a gift.

original: de ltar skyen par mi byed do //
analyzed: de ltar skyen par mi byed do //
translated: I will not be quick to give, having begun with a gift.‚Äù

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is generosity without conceit?üîΩA bodhisattva does not give in this way:

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di ltar sbyin pa 'di'i 'bras bu med do zhe'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di ltar sbyin pa 'di'i 'bras bu med do zhe'am /
translated: ‚ÄúThis gift of mine is without result,

original: 'tshe ba'i sbyin pas chos su 'gyur ro zhe'am /
analyzed: 'tshe ba'i sbyin pas chos su 'gyur ro zhe'am /
translated: or it is a gift that is harmful, or

original: sbyin pa shin tu rdzogs pa tsam gyis 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag par 'gyur ro zhes lta bas mchog tu 'dzin par mi byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa shin tu rdzogs pa tsam gyis 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag par 'gyur ro zhes lta bas mchog tu 'dzin par mi byed do //
translated: it is a gift that is completely fulfilled, and by that alone one becomes purified in this life, or one becomes purified in a heavenly life, or one becomes purified in an existence as a human.‚Äù

original: bsags pa med pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsags pa med pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is generosity without accumulation?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin par bya ba'i chos yun ring por bsags shing tshogs byas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin par bya ba'i chos yun ring por bsags shing tshogs byas nas /
translated: Bodhisattvas have accumulated and gathered the things to be given over a long period of time.

original: phyis cig car sbyin pa sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: phyis cig car sbyin pa sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva does not give a gift of things to be given all at once after accumulating and collecting them over a long time.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin par byed pa'i chos gang dag yod bzhin du slong ba po legs par 'ongs pa phyir bzlog par mi @73a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin par byed pa'i chos gang dag yod bzhin du slong ba po legs par 'ongs pa phyir bzlog par mi @73a * //
translated: The bodhisattva does not turn away a worthy supplicant who has come, even though he has the things to be given.

original: byed la ; gang gis phyir bzlog par bya ba'i 'os kyang mi mthong na sogs par lta ga la byed /
analyzed: byed la ; gang gis phyir bzlog par bya ba'i 'os kyang mi mthong na sogs par lta ga la byed /
translated: If he does not see anyone who deserves to be turned away, how much less would he accumulate things to be given.

original: byang chub sems dpas ni bsags pa'i sbyin pa las bsod nams 'du ba'i sgo lhag par 'gyur bar ma mthong ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas ni bsags pa'i sbyin pa las bsod nams 'du ba'i sgo lhag par 'gyur bar ma mthong ste /
translated: The bodhisattva does not see a greater source of merit than the gift of accumulated things.

original: sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yang mtshungs la /
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yang mtshungs la /
translated: The things to be given are the same.

original: slong ba po snga phyi dang mgo mnyam du 'ongs pa dang mtshungs pa rnams la mthar gyis sbyin pa dang / cig car sbyin pa na /
analyzed: slong ba po snga phyi dang mgo mnyam du 'ongs pa dang mtshungs pa rnams la mthar gyis sbyin pa dang / cig car sbyin pa na /
translated: When he gives to supplicants who come earlier and later and at the same time, in sequence and all at once,

original: ci'i phyir bsod nams khyad par yod par yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur snyam du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsod nams khyad par yod par yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur snyam du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it that he sees the merit as being different?

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i bsags pa'i sbyin pa ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin gyi longs spyod ji ltar byung ba bzhin du sbyin pa ni kha na ma tho ba med par mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i bsags pa'i sbyin pa ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin gyi longs spyod ji ltar byung ba bzhin du sbyin pa ni kha na ma tho ba med par mthong ngo //
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva sees that giving that is hoarding is blameworthy, but giving that is in accordance with what has been obtained is not blameworthy.üîΩWhy is that?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because,

original: 'di ltar bsags pa'i sbyin pa sbyin pas ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsags pa'i sbyin pa sbyin pas ni /
translated: by giving a gift that is hoarding,

original: slong ba po rnams kyis bslangs na sngar slong ba brgya phyir bzlog nas de dag gis kun nas mnar sems dang / mi bzod pa dang / yid mi ches pa bskyed pa'i 'og tu ma bslangs par yang kha cig la bsags pa'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: slong ba po rnams kyis bslangs na sngar slong ba brgya phyir bzlog nas de dag gis kun nas mnar sems dang / mi bzod pa dang / yid mi ches pa bskyed pa'i 'og tu ma bslangs par yang kha cig la bsags pa'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: when beggars ask for something, after a hundred times turning them away, he generates hostility, intolerance, and lack of confidence in them.

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni bsags te sbyin pa sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni bsags te sbyin pa sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva does not give a gift that is hoarding.

original: khengs pa med pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: khengs pa med pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is giving without pride?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba po la dma' ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba po la dma' ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva does not give gifts to beggars with a spirit of contempt.

original: gzhan la 'gran pa'i phyir yang sbyin par mi byed do //üîΩsbyin pa byin nas kyang bdag nyid ni gtong phod cing sbyin pa'i bdag po yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan la 'gran pa'i phyir yang sbyin par mi byed do // sbyin pa byin nas kyang bdag nyid ni gtong phod cing sbyin pa'i bdag po yin gyi /
translated: He does not give gifts in order to compete with others.

original: gzhan dag de ni lta ma yin no snyam du sbyin pa des rlom sems su mi byed do//
analyzed: gzhan dag de ni lta ma yin no snyam du sbyin pa des rlom sems su mi byed do//
translated: And after he has given a gift, he does not boast about himself, nor does he disparage others.

original: mi brten pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi brten pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is giving without attachment?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni grags pa dang / sgra dang / tshigs su bcad pa la brten cing sbyin pa sbyin par mi byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni grags pa dang / sgra dang / tshigs su bcad pa la brten cing sbyin pa sbyin par mi byed de /
translated: The bodhisattva does not give gifts in order to gain fame, reputation, and praise,

original: grags pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i yi ge las byung ba dang / sgra tsam dang 'brel pa dang / lo ma skam po lta bu yin par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: grags pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i yi ge las byung ba dang / sgra tsam dang 'brel pa dang / lo ma skam po lta bu yin par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because he considers fame to be a mere concept, a mere sound, and like dry leaves.

original: ; zhum pa med pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ; zhum pa med pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is giving without weakness?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin pa'i snga rol nas yid dga' zhing sbyin pa'i tshe sems dang bar byed la byin nas kyang 'gyod pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin pa'i snga rol nas yid dga' zhing sbyin pa'i tshe sems dang bar byed la byin nas kyang 'gyod pa med pa yin no //
translated: Here the bodhisattva is delighted before giving, is gladdened while giving, and has no regrets after giving.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa yangs shing mchog tu rgya che ba dag thos @73b na yang bdag nyid la khyad du gsod cing zhum par mi byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa yangs shing mchog tu rgya che ba dag thos @73b na yang bdag nyid la khyad du gsod cing zhum par mi byed do //
translated: Even when he hears of the vast and sublime generosity of the bodhisattvas, he does not despise himself nor become timid.

original: ngan pa ma yin pa sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ngan pa ma yin pa sbyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is giving that is not low?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin par bya ba'i chos dag las nan tan du gdams shing gdams shing zas dang / skom dang / bzhon pa dang / gos la sogs pa mchog dang / rab mchog gang yin pa de dag sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin par bya ba'i chos dag las nan tan du gdams shing gdams shing zas dang / skom dang / bzhon pa dang / gos la sogs pa mchog dang / rab mchog gang yin pa de dag sbyin par byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva, having carefully considered the things to be given, gives the best, the most excellent, of the things to be given, such as food, drink, vehicles, clothing, etc.

original: rgyab kyis phyogs pa med pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyab kyis phyogs pa med pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is giving that is not turned back?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni snyoms pa'i sems kyis mdza' bo dang / dgra dang / tha mal pa rnams la phyogs su 'byed pa med par snyoms pa'i snying rjes sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni snyoms pa'i sems kyis mdza' bo dang / dgra dang / tha mal pa rnams la phyogs su 'byed pa med par snyoms pa'i snying rjes sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva gives gifts with an impartial mind, with a compassion that is the same toward friends, foes, and strangers.

original: lan la mi lta ba'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: lan la mi lta ba'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is giving without expectation of reward?

original: byang chub sems dpa' snying rje'i sems dang / snying brtse ba'i sems dang ldan par sbyin pa sbyin par ni pha rol las lan du phan 'dogs su re ba med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' snying rje'i sems dang / snying brtse ba'i sems dang ldan par sbyin pa sbyin par ni pha rol las lan du phan 'dogs su re ba med do //
translated: The bodhisattva gives gifts with a compassionate mind, a sympathetic mind, and does not expect to receive anything in return.

original: skye bo bde bar 'dod pa dang / sred pa'i mes tshig pa dang / mthu med pa dang / rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba dag mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bo bde bar 'dod pa dang / sred pa'i mes tshig pa dang / mthu med pa dang / rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba dag mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he sees that people are tormented by the fire of craving, are powerless, and are naturally miserable.

original: rnam par smin pa la mi lta ba'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la mi lta ba'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is giving without concern for material reward?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin pa byin nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin pa byin nas /
translated: The bodhisattva, having given a gift,üîΩdoes not expect

original: phyi ma la longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa'am /
analyzed: phyi ma la longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa'am /
translated: a reward in the future.

original: lus phun sum tshogs par gyur par sbyin pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la re ba med do //
analyzed: lus phun sum tshogs par gyur par sbyin pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la re ba med do //
translated: He does not expect a karmic reward, a ripened result, for his perfect body.

original: 'du byed thams cad ni snying po med par lta la /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni snying po med par lta la /
translated: He sees all compounded things as having no essence.

original: byang chub mchog la ni phan yon du lta ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub mchog la ni phan yon du lta ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He sees the highest enlightenment as beneficial.

original: rnam pa bcu po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa rnam par dag cing shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa rnam par dag cing shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: In these ten ways the bodhisattvas‚Äô generosity is purified and becomes extremely pure.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams sbyin pa rnam pa dgu po 'di dag la brten te /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams sbyin pa rnam pa dgu po 'di dag la brten te /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattvas, on the basis of these nine kinds of generosity,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: complete the perfection of generosity

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas las sbyin pa'i le'u ste dgu pa'o /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro // byang chub sems dpa' sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas las sbyin pa'i le'u ste dgu pa'o /
translated: and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: // / bam po brgyad pa /
analyzed: // / bam po brgyad pa /
translated: This concludes the ninth chapter, on generosity, in the Ornament of the Bodhisattva‚Äôs Course of Conduct.

original: sdom ni / ngo bo nyid dang thams cad dang // dka' ba dang ni sgo kun dang // skyes bu dam pa ldan pa dang // de bzhin rnam pa thams cad dang // phongs shing 'dod pa ldan pa dang // 'di dang gzhan du bde 'gyur dang //üîΩrnam par dag dang rnam dgu ste //
analyzed: sdom ni / ngo bo nyid dang thams cad dang // dka' ba dang ni sgo kun dang // skyes bu dam pa ldan pa dang // de bzhin rnam pa thams cad dang // phongs shing 'dod pa ldan pa dang // 'di dang gzhan du bde 'gyur dang // rnam par dag dang rnam dgu ste //
translated: endowed with want and desire,üîΩconducive to happiness in this life and the next,üîΩand pure‚Äî

original: mdor na tshul khrims @74a * //üîΩde yin no //
analyzed: mdor na tshul khrims @74a * // de yin no //
translated: in brief, ethics is ninefold.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims gang zhe na /
translated: What is the ethics of bodhisattvas?

original: de ni rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as ninefold:

original: tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid dang / tshul khrims thams cad dang / dka' ba'i tshul khrims dang / thams cad kyi sgo nas tshul khrims dang / skyes bu dam pa'i tshul khrims dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi tshul khrims dang / phongs shing 'dod pa la tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid dang / tshul khrims thams cad dang / dka' ba'i tshul khrims dang / thams cad kyi sgo nas tshul khrims dang / skyes bu dam pa'i tshul khrims dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi tshul khrims dang / phongs shing 'dod pa la tshul khrims dang /
translated: the essence of ethics, all ethics, difficult ethics, ethics in all its forms, ethics of holy beings, ethics in all its aspects, ethics endowed with want and desire,

original: 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims dang / rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims dang / rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: morality that leads to happiness in this life and the next, and pure morality.

original: de la tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the essence of morality?

original: mdor bsdu na yon tan rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na yon tan rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, the essence of morality for the bodhisattvas should be understood as having four virtues:

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: pha rol las legs par yang dag par blangs pa dang / bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / nyams par gyur na phyir gso bar byed pa dang / mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir gus pa bskyed nas dran pa nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol las legs par yang dag par blangs pa dang / bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / nyams par gyur na phyir gso bar byed pa dang / mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir gus pa bskyed nas dran pa nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: It is taken well from another, with a very pure intention, it is restored when broken, and it is maintained with respect in order not to be broken.

original: de la pha rol las tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pas ni /
analyzed: de la pha rol las tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pas ni /
translated: By taking morality well from another,

original: byang chub sems dpa' bslab pa las nyams par byed pa na pha rol la brten te khrel yod pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bslab pa las nyams par byed pa na pha rol la brten te khrel yod pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: when a bodhisattva breaks a precept, he experiences shame in relation to others.

original: bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag pas ni byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims rnams la bslab pa nyams par byed pa na bdag nyid la brten nas ngo tsha shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //üîΩbslab pa'i gzhi nyams pa rnams sor chud nas thog ma nyid nas nyams par mi 'gyur bar gus pa skyes pa'i rgyu 'di gnyis kyis ni byang chub sems dpa' 'gyod pa med par 'gyur te /

original: de la pha rol las yang dag par blangs pa gang yin pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i chos gang yin pa 'di gnyis mi nyams pa las phyir gso ba gang yin pa dang / nyams par mi 'gyur bar @74b gus par byed pa gang yin pa'i chos 'di gnyis 'dren pa yin no //
analyzed: de la pha rol las yang dag par blangs pa gang yin pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i chos gang yin pa 'di gnyis mi nyams pa las phyir gso ba gang yin pa dang / nyams par mi 'gyur bar @74b gus par byed pa gang yin pa'i chos 'di gnyis 'dren pa yin no //
translated: Of these, the first two are the taking of the vow from another and the purity of superior intention. The latter two are the restoration of the vow when it has degenerated and the respect that prevents its degeneration.

original: de la pha rol las yang dag par blangs pa gang yin pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag pa gang yin pa dang / nyams par mi 'gyur bar gus par byed pa gang yin pa'i chos 'di gsum gyis ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims nyams par mi 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la pha rol las yang dag par blangs pa gang yin pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag pa gang yin pa dang / nyams par mi 'gyur bar gus par byed pa gang yin pa'i chos 'di gsum gyis ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims nyams par mi 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Of these, the first three are to be known as the morality of the bodhisattva that does not degenerate.

original: nyams pa las phyir gso bar byed pas ni zhig pa las phyir 'chos shing slong bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyams pa las phyir gso bar byed pas ni zhig pa las phyir 'chos shing slong bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The restoration of the vow when it has degenerated is to be known as the mending of the broken vow.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid yon tan bzhi dang ldan pa de ni yang dag par blangs pa dang / rjes su slob pas bdag la phan pa dang / gzhan la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la phan pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid yon tan bzhi dang ldan pa de ni yang dag par blangs pa dang / rjes su slob pas bdag la phan pa dang / gzhan la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la phan pa dang /
translated: The morality of the bodhisattvas, which has these four virtues as its own nature, should be understood as virtuous because it benefits oneself and others through its undertaking and its practice,üîΩand because it brings happiness and benefit to many people,

original: skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mi rnams kyi don dang / phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dge ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mi rnams kyi don dang / phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dge ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: because it is compassion for the world, and because it leads to the welfare, benefit, and happiness of gods and humans.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i gzhi dpag tu med pa yongs su bsdus pas dpag tu med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i gzhi dpag tu med pa yongs su bsdus pas dpag tu med par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as immeasurable because it includes the immeasurable bases of bodhisattva training.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir nye bar gnas pas sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir nye bar gnas pas sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as benefiting all beings because it is present for the benefit and happiness of all beings.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin cing sbyin par byed pas 'bras bu dang phan yon che bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin cing sbyin par byed pas 'bras bu dang phan yon che bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it has great results and benefits because it takes hold of and bestows the result, which is unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims thams cad gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims thams cad gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva‚Äôs morality in its entirety?

original: mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims khyim pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa ni tshul khrims thams cad ces bya'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims khyim pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa ni tshul khrims thams cad ces bya'o //
translated: In brief, the bodhisattva‚Äôs morality is twofold: that which pertains to the faction of householders and that which pertains to the faction of those gone forth.

original: khyim pa'i phyogs la brten pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la brten pa'i tshul khrims de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: khyim pa'i phyogs la brten pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la brten pa'i tshul khrims de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The morality of those who are householders and of those who have gone forth is also threefold:

original: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i tshul khrims so ;
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i tshul khrims so ;
translated: the morality of restraint, the morality of acquiring virtue, and the morality of acting for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: / de la byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa ris bdun po dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma'i tshul khrims gang yin pa ste /üîΩde yang khyim pa dang / rab tu byung @75a * //
analyzed: / de la byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa ris bdun po dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma'i tshul khrims gang yin pa ste / de yang khyim pa dang / rab tu byung @75a * //
translated: The morality of the vow of the bodhisattva is the morality of the seven classes of the vow of individual liberation, the morality of the monk, nun, male and female novice, male and female devotee.

original: ba'i phyogs la ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ba'i phyogs la ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is to be understood as appropriate for the householder and the renunciate.üîΩThe morality of gathering virtuous natures is whatever accumulation of virtue by body and speech there is after the bodhisattva has taken the vow of morality, for the sake of great enlightenment.

original: de la dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims ni byang chub sems dpas sdom pa'i tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa'i 'og tu byang chub chen po'i phyir lus dang ngag gis dge ba bsags pa gang ci yang rung ba de dag thams cad ni mdor bsdu na
analyzed: de la dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims ni byang chub sems dpas sdom pa'i tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa'i 'og tu byang chub chen po'i phyir lus dang ngag gis dge ba bsags pa gang ci yang rung ba de dag thams cad ni mdor bsdu na
translated: All of that, in brief,

original: / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
translated: is called the morality of gathering virtuous natures.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni tshul khrims la brten cing tshul khrims la gnas nas /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni tshul khrims la brten cing tshul khrims la gnas nas /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva, relying on morality and abiding in morality,

original: thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / zhi gnas dang / lha mthong bsgom pa dang / gcig tu dga' ba la brtson par byed do //
analyzed: thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / zhi gnas dang / lha mthong bsgom pa dang / gcig tu dga' ba la brtson par byed do //
translated: strives to listen, to reflect, to cultivate serenity and insight, and to delight in solitude.

original: de bzhin du bla ma rnams la dus dus su gus par smra ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / myur du ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bla ma rnams la dus dus su gus par smra ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / myur du ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, from time to time he or she respectfully speaks to the gurus, bows down to them, rises up quickly, and respectfully raises his or her joined palms to them.

original: de bzhin du dus dus su bla ma de dag nyid la gus par rim gro byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dus dus su bla ma de dag nyid la gus par rim gro byed pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, from time to time he or she respectfully serves those very gurus.

original: nad pa rnams la rim gro byas te /
analyzed: nad pa rnams la rim gro byas te /
translated: He or she attends on the sick and,

original: snying rjes nad g-yog byed pa yin no //
analyzed: snying rjes nad g-yog byed pa yin no //
translated: out of compassion, nurses them.

original: de bzhin du legs par smras pa la legs so zhes bya ba sbyin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du legs par smras pa la legs so zhes bya ba sbyin par byed pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, he or she gives the approval of ‚Äúgood‚Äù to those who speak well.

original: gang zag yon tan dang ldan pa rnams kyi yang dag pa'i bsngags pa kun rjod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zag yon tan dang ldan pa rnams kyi yang dag pa'i bsngags pa kun rjod par byed pa yin no //
translated: He or she proclaims the true praise of those persons who possess good qualities.

original: de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i sems can thams cad kyi bsod nams thams cad la bsam pa thag pa nas dga' ba'i sems bskyed nas tshig tu brjod cing rjes su yi rang bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i sems can thams cad kyi bsod nams thams cad la bsam pa thag pa nas dga' ba'i sems bskyed nas tshig tu brjod cing rjes su yi rang bar byed pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, he should rejoice in the merit of all sentient beings in the ten directions, and express that rejoicing with words.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag gis nyes pa byad pa thams cad la so sor brtags te bzod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag gis nyes pa byad pa thams cad la so sor brtags te bzod par byed pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, he should cultivate patience toward all the harms done by others, examining them individually.

original: de bzhin du lus dang ngag dang yid kyis dge ba byas pa dang / ma byas pa thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du lus dang ngag dang yid kyis dge ba byas pa dang / ma byas pa thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, he should dedicate all his own virtue, done and to be done by body, speech, and mind, to unexcelled perfect enlightenment.

original: dus dus su yang dag par smon lam rnam pa sna tshogs 'debs pa dang / dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa rgya chen po rnam pa thams cad byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dus dus su yang dag par smon lam rnam pa sna tshogs 'debs pa dang / dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa rgya chen po rnam pa thams cad byed pa yin no //
translated: From time to time, he should make various true aspirations, and should make vast offerings to the Three Jewels in all ways.

original: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i phyogs rnams la brtson zhing brtson 'grus rtsom par byed de /
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i phyogs rnams la brtson zhing brtson 'grus rtsom par byed de /
translated: He should always be energetic, always making an effort in virtue.

original: bag yod par gnas pa yin no //üîΩlus dang ngag gis bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la dran pa dang shes bzhin du spyod pas kun nas srung bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bag yod par gnas pa yin no // lus dang ngag gis bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la dran pa dang shes bzhin du spyod pas kun nas srung bar byed pa yin no //
translated: He is one who abides with carefulness.

original: dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsrung shing zas kyi @75b tshod rig pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsrung shing zas kyi @75b tshod rig pa yin no //
translated: He is one who guards the doors of his senses and is moderate in eating.

original: nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba la brtson pa yin no //
analyzed: nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba la brtson pa yin no //
translated: He is one who is intent on being active during the first and last parts of the night.

original: skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa yin no //
translated: He is one who associates with holy people and cultivates spiritual teachers.

original: bdag gi 'khrul pa rnams kyang yongs su shes shing nyes par lta ba yin te /
analyzed: bdag gi 'khrul pa rnams kyang yongs su shes shing nyes par lta ba yin te /
translated: He is one who recognizes his own mistakes and sees them as faults.

original: shes shing nyes par mthong nas kyang gtong bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: shes shing nyes par mthong nas kyang gtong bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Having recognized and seen them as faults, he abandons them.

original: 'khrul pa yang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnams dang / chos mthun pa rnams la nyes pa 'chags par byed de /
analyzed: 'khrul pa yang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnams dang / chos mthun pa rnams la nyes pa 'chags par byed de /
translated: He confesses his mistakes to the Buddhas, the bodhisattvas, and those who are in agreement with the Dharma.

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams sgrub pa dang / srung ba dang / rnam par 'phel bar byed pa'i tshul khrims gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams sgrub pa dang / srung ba dang / rnam par 'phel bar byed pa'i tshul khrims gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
translated: The morality that is the practice, protection, and increase of such virtuous qualities is called the bodhisattva's morality of acquiring virtue.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i tshul khrims gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i tshul khrims gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva's morality of benefiting sentient beings?

original: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bcu gcig tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bcu gcig tu rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be known in brief as being of eleven kinds.

original: rnam pa bcu gcig gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gcig gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eleven kinds?

original: sems can gyi bya ba don dang ldan pa rnam pa sna tshogs la grogs byed cing /
analyzed: sems can gyi bya ba don dang ldan pa rnam pa sna tshogs la grogs byed cing /
translated: It is the assistance given to sentient beings in various ways in their meaningful activities.

original: sems can rnams la nad la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal byung ngo cog la nad g-yog la sogs pas grogs byed pa dang / de bzhin du 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don rnams la chos bstan pa sngon du gtong ba dang / thabs bstan pa sngon du gtong ba'i rigs pa ston pa dang /
analyzed: sems can rnams la nad la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal byung ngo cog la nad g-yog la sogs pas grogs byed pa dang / de bzhin du 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don rnams la chos bstan pa sngon du gtong ba dang / thabs bstan pa sngon du gtong ba'i rigs pa ston pa dang /
translated: They help beings who are sick and so on by nursing them and so forth, and likewise they teach them the mundane and supramundane goals. They teach them the reasoning of the instructions and the reasoning of the teaching of methods.

original: phan 'dogs pa'i sems can rnams la byas pa gzo ba rjes su bsrung zhing 'tsham par lan du phan 'dogs pas nye bar gnas pa dang / seng ge dang / stag dang / rgyal po dang / chom rkun dang / chu dang me la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa'i gnas rnam pa sna tshogs las sems can rnams kun nas bsrung ba dang /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa'i sems can rnams la byas pa gzo ba rjes su bsrung zhing 'tsham par lan du phan 'dogs pas nye bar gnas pa dang / seng ge dang / stag dang / rgyal po dang / chom rkun dang / chu dang me la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa'i gnas rnam pa sna tshogs las sems can rnams kun nas bsrung ba dang /
translated: They repay the kindness of those beings who have benefited them by protecting them and by helping them in a fitting way. They completely protect beings from various dangers such as lions, tigers, kings, robbers, water, and fire.

original: longs spyod dang / gnyen gyi sdug bsngal bar gnas pa rnams la mya ngam sel ba dang / sems can yo byad kyis phongs pa rnams la rigs pas yo byad thams cad nye bar sgrub par dang / yang dag pa'i rten sbyin pas chos kyi tshogs yongs su sdud pa dang /
analyzed: longs spyod dang / gnyen gyi sdug bsngal bar gnas pa rnams la mya ngam sel ba dang / sems can yo byad kyis phongs pa rnams la rigs pas yo byad thams cad nye bar sgrub par dang / yang dag pa'i rten sbyin pas chos kyi tshogs yongs su sdud pa dang /
translated: It is to gather the accumulations of the Dharma by giving the right support.

original: smra ba dang / kun tu smra ba dang / so sor yang dag par dga' bar bya bas dus dus su thad du 'gro ba dang / gzhan las zas dang / skom la sogs pa len pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i don dang mthun par spyod pa dang /
analyzed: smra ba dang / kun tu smra ba dang / so sor yang dag par dga' bar bya bas dus dus su thad du 'gro ba dang / gzhan las zas dang / skom la sogs pa len pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i don dang mthun par spyod pa dang /
translated: It is to go to those who are speaking, conversing, and rejoicing from time to time, to receive food, drink, and so forth from others, and to act in accordance with worldly aims.

original: bos na 'ong zhing 'gro ba dang / mdor bsdu na @76a * //
analyzed: bos na 'ong zhing 'gro ba dang / mdor bsdu na @76a * //
translated: It is to come when called and to go when dismissed.

original: don dang ldan pa ma yin pa yid du mi 'ong ba kun tu spyod pa thams cad ma gtogs pa la sems dang mthun par byed pa dang / de nyid kyi yang dag pa'i yon tan rnams lkog gam /
analyzed: don dang ldan pa ma yin pa yid du mi 'ong ba kun tu spyod pa thams cad ma gtogs pa la sems dang mthun par byed pa dang / de nyid kyi yang dag pa'i yon tan rnams lkog gam /
translated: In short, it is to act in accordance with the mind, except for all that is not meaningful and unpleasant.

original: ming sngar bsgrags pas yang dag par dga' bar bya ba dang / 'di lta ste /üîΩmi dge ba'i /
analyzed: ming sngar bsgrags pas yang dag par dga' bar bya ba dang / 'di lta ste / mi dge ba'i /
translated: By the above-mentioned names, he is the one who delights perfectly.

original: gnas nas bslang ste /
analyzed: gnas nas bslang ste /
translated: He is the one who uplifts from non-virtue.

translated: How could he utter evil words or

original: byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa ni dge ba mi spyoms shing sdig pa rnam par 'byed pa dang / 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa dang / yongs su gdung ba med pa'i rang bzhin can dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa ni dge ba mi spyoms shing sdig pa rnam par 'byed pa dang / 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa dang / yongs su gdung ba med pa'i rang bzhin can dang /
translated: Bodhisattvas who keep the ethics of restraint do not boast about their virtues, they confess their negative actions, they have few desires, they are content, they are indifferent to suffering, they are by nature free of regret,

analyzed: yan lag bcu po de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa 'di lta ste /
