analyzed: ngag dang rtogs pa yongs su dag par byed pa dang / bdag nyid la khyad du mi gsod pa dang / des pa dang / bzod pa dang / bag yod pa dang / cho ga dang / 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa'i phyir legs par gdams pa'i tshul khrims can yin no //
translated: He is well-disciplined in that he purifies his speech and thoughts, does not disparage himself, and is gentle, patient, and conscientious, and in that he purifies his behavior and livelihood.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa ni lus dang longs spyod la lta ba byung ba chung ngu yang dang du len par mi byed na mang po lta ci smos /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa ni lus dang longs spyod la lta ba byung ba chung ngu yang dang du len par mi byed na mang po lta ci smos /
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the morality of gathering virtuous factors does not tolerate even a slight occurrence of the view of the body as beautiful, much less a great one.

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi gzhir gyur pa nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa la sogs pa byung ba thams cad dang du len par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi gzhir gyur pa nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa la sogs pa byung ba thams cad dang du len par mi byed do //
translated: He does not tolerate any of the afflictions or secondary afflictions that are the basis of immorality, such as anger, resentment, etc.

original: gzhan dag la kun nas mnar sems dang / khong khro ba dang / 'khon pa'i sems byung ba dang du len par mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag la kun nas mnar sems dang / khong khro ba dang / 'khon pa'i sems byung ba dang du len par mi byed do //
translated: He does not tolerate any malice, anger, or resentment that arises toward others.

original: snyom las dang le lo skyes pa dang du len par mi byed do //üîΩsnyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myong ba dang / snyoms @78a * //
analyzed: snyom las dang le lo skyes pa dang du len par mi byed do // snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myong ba dang / snyoms @78a * //
translated: He does not tolerate any laziness or sloth that arises.

original: par 'jug pa'i nyon mongs pa byung ba dang du len par mi byed do //
analyzed: par 'jug pa'i nyon mongs pa byung ba dang du len par mi byed do //
translated: He does not tolerate any relishing of meditative concentration or any affliction that arises in meditative concentration.

original: gnas lnga yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: gnas lnga yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: He knows well the five topics:

original: dge ba'i 'bras bu'i phan yon yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dge ba'i 'bras bu'i phan yon yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows well the benefits of the results of virtue.

original: dge ba'i rgyu dang / dge ba'i rgyu'i 'bras bu la phyin ci log pa dang ; phyin ci ma log pa dang / dge ba sdud pa la bar du gcod pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rgyu dang / dge ba'i rgyu'i 'bras bu la phyin ci log pa dang ; phyin ci ma log pa dang / dge ba sdud pa la bar du gcod pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows well the cause of virtue, the result of the cause of virtue, error and non-error, and the obstacles to the accumulation of virtue.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni dge ba'i 'bras bu la phan yon du mthong nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni dge ba'i 'bras bu la phan yon du mthong nas /
translated: The bodhisattva, seeing the result of virtue as beneficial,

original: dge ba sdud pa'i phyir dge ba'i rgyu yongs su tshol lo //
analyzed: dge ba sdud pa'i phyir dge ba'i rgyu yongs su tshol lo //
translated: seeks the cause of virtue in order to accumulate virtue.

original: byang chub sems dpas phyin ci log pa dang ; phyin ci ma log pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas phyin ci log pa dang ; phyin ci ma log pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: The bodhisattva knows well error and non-error as they really are.

original: dge ba'i 'bras bu thob nas mi rtag pa la rtag par lta bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dge ba'i 'bras bu thob nas mi rtag pa la rtag par lta bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Having obtained the result of virtue, he does not see the impermanent as permanent,

original: sdug bsngal ba la bde bar lta bar mi 'gyur mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar lta bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba la bde bar lta bar mi 'gyur mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar lta bar mi 'gyur /
translated: does not see suffering as happiness, does not see the impure as pure,

original: bdag med pa la bdag tu lta bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa la bdag tu lta bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and does not see the insubstantial as substantial.

original: dge ba sdud pa'i bar du gcod pa yang rab tu shes nas yongs su spong bar byed do //üîΩrnam pa bcu gnyis po 'di dag gis dge ba sdud pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa de myur ba kho nar dge ba sdud bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dge ba sdud pa'i bar du gcod pa yang rab tu shes nas yongs su spong bar byed do // rnam pa bcu gnyis po 'di dag gis dge ba sdud pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa de myur ba kho nar dge ba sdud bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Having understood the obstacles to the accumulation of virtue, he or she avoids them.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyang sdud par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyang sdud par 'gyur te /
translated: By means of these twelve aspects, the bodhisattva who is established in the morality of acquiring virtue quickly acquires virtue and acquires it in all its aspects.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: That is to say,

original: sbyin pa'i nyer gnas dang / tshul khrims kyi nyer gnas dang / bzod pa'i nyer gnas dang / brtson 'grus kyi nyer gnas dang / bsam gtan gyi nyer gnas dang / shes rab kyi rnam pa lngas sdud do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i nyer gnas dang / tshul khrims kyi nyer gnas dang / bzod pa'i nyer gnas dang / brtson 'grus kyi nyer gnas dang / bsam gtan gyi nyer gnas dang / shes rab kyi rnam pa lngas sdud do //
translated: he or she acquires it by means of the five aspects of generosity, morality, patience, effort, and meditation.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa bcu gcig gis sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims rnam pa thams cad la gnas pa ni rnam pa re re yang rnam pa thams cad kyi rnam pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa bcu gcig gis sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims rnam pa thams cad la gnas pa ni rnam pa re re yang rnam pa thams cad kyi rnam pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva who is established in all the aspects of the morality of benefiting sentient beings by means of eleven aspects has each aspect endowed with all the aspects.

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams kyi bya ba de dang de dag la grogs su 'gro ba na /üîΩbya ba sems pa dang / bya ba gtan la 'bebs pa dang / lam du 'gro zhing 'ong ba dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' la sbyor ba dang / longs spyod rnams ba srung ba dang / bya ba rnams phan tshun sdum pa dang /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams kyi bya ba de dang de dag la grogs su 'gro ba na / bya ba sems pa dang / bya ba gtan la 'bebs pa dang / lam du 'gro zhing 'ong ba dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' la sbyor ba dang / longs spyod rnams ba srung ba dang / bya ba rnams phan tshun sdum pa dang /
translated: Here a bodhisattva acts as a companion to sentient beings in all their activities.üîΩHe or she is a companion in reflection on what should be done, in determining what should be done, in going and coming on a journey, in applying oneself to right action, in protecting possessions, in reconciling those who are in conflict,

original: dga' ston dang bsod nams bya ba la grogs su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ston dang bsod nams bya ba la grogs su 'gro ba'o //
translated: and in celebrating and making merit.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi grogs su 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi grogs su 'gro bar byed do //
translated: Moreover, a bodhisattva acts as a companion to those who are suffering.

original: sems can nad kyis @78b thebs pa rnams kyi nad g-yog byed do //
analyzed: sems can nad kyis @78b thebs pa rnams kyi nad g-yog byed do //
translated: He or she acts as a nurse to sentient beings who are sick.

original: long ba rnams khrid cing lam ston par byed do //
analyzed: long ba rnams khrid cing lam ston par byed do //
translated: He or she leads the blind and shows the path to those who are visually impaired.

original: 'on pa rnams la ming gi mtshan ma ston pa'i sgo nas lag brdas don go bar byed do //
analyzed: 'on pa rnams la ming gi mtshan ma ston pa'i sgo nas lag brdas don go bar byed do //
translated: He or she makes the deaf understand by using sign language to indicate the meaning of words.

original: rkang lag med pa rnams la mgo bo'am /
analyzed: rkang lag med pa rnams la mgo bo'am /
translated: He or she carries on his or her head or in his or her arms those who are without arms or legs.

original: bzhon pas bteg ste khyer bar byed do //üîΩsems can 'dod pa'i 'dun pas kun nas dkris pas sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi 'dod pa'i 'dun pas kun nas dkris pa'i sdug bsngal sel bar byed do //üîΩsems can gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom gyi kun nas dkris pas sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi the tshom gyi kun nas dkris pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: bzhon pas bteg ste khyer bar byed do // sems can 'dod pa'i 'dun pas kun nas dkris pas sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi 'dod pa'i 'dun pas kun nas dkris pa'i sdug bsngal sel bar byed do // sems can gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom gyi kun nas dkris pas sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi the tshom gyi kun nas dkris pa sel bar byed do //
translated: and then he carries them away on his vehicle.üîΩHe removes the suffering of those beings who are tormented by the fetter of sensuality, by the suffering of the fetter of sensuality.üîΩHe removes the suffering of those beings who are tormented by the fetter of malice, torpor, restlessness, regret, and doubt, by the suffering of the fetter of doubt.

original: sems can 'dod pa'i rtog pas kun nas dkris pas sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi 'dod pa'i rtog pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: sems can 'dod pa'i rtog pas kun nas dkris pas sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi 'dod pa'i rtog pa sel bar byed do //
translated: He removes the suffering of those beings who are tormented by the fetter of sensuality, by the suffering of the fetter of sensuality.

original: 'dod pa'i rtog pa ci lta ba bzhin du gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / nye du dang / yul gyi mi dang / mi 'chi ba'i rtog pa dang / khyad du gsong pa dang ldan pa dang / khyim gyi 'byor pa dang ldan pa'i rtog pa yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rtog pa ci lta ba bzhin du gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / nye du dang / yul gyi mi dang / mi 'chi ba'i rtog pa dang / khyad du gsong pa dang ldan pa dang / khyim gyi 'byor pa dang ldan pa'i rtog pa yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as with thoughts of desire, so also with thoughts of malice, violence, relatives, country, death, arrogance, and thoughts of wealth and family.

original: sems can gzhan gyis sma phab cing pham par byas pa'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi gzhan gyis sma phab cing pham par byas pa'i sdug bsngal sel bar byed do //
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyis sma phab cing pham par byas pa'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi gzhan gyis sma phab cing pham par byas pa'i sdug bsngal sel bar byed do //
translated: He removes the suffering of those who are suffering from the suffering of being humiliated and defeated by others.

original: lam gyis ngal bar gyur pa rnams la gnas dang stan sbyin pa dang / lus mnye bas ngal dub pa'i sdug bsngal sel bar byed do //
analyzed: lam gyis ngal bar gyur pa rnams la gnas dang stan sbyin pa dang / lus mnye bas ngal dub pa'i sdug bsngal sel bar byed do //
translated: He removes the suffering of fatigue of those who are tired from traveling by giving them a place to stay and a bed, and by massaging and rubbing their limbs.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams la rigs pas ston par byed do //
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams la rigs pas ston par byed do //
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva teaches beings in a reasonable way.

original: sems can nyes par spyad pa spyod pa rnams kyi nyes par spyad pa spang ba'i phyir tshig 'bru 'byor pa rnams dang / 'brel pa rnams dang / rjes su mthun pa rnams dang / rjes su 'phrod pa rnams dang / thabs dang ldan pa rnams dang /
analyzed: sems can nyes par spyad pa spyod pa rnams kyi nyes par spyad pa spang ba'i phyir tshig 'bru 'byor pa rnams dang / 'brel pa rnams dang / rjes su mthun pa rnams dang / rjes su 'phrod pa rnams dang / thabs dang ldan pa rnams dang /
translated: For sentient beings who engage in negative actions, he teaches the Dharma with well-formed words, connected words, appropriate words, suitable words, skillful words,

original: 'tsham pa rnams dang / mthun pa rnams dang / 'grus skyong gi yan lag gi tshogs rnams kyis chos ston to //
analyzed: 'tsham pa rnams dang / mthun pa rnams dang / 'grus skyong gi yan lag gi tshogs rnams kyis chos ston to //
translated: fitting words, compatible words, and with a collection of the limbs of exertion.

original: yang na thabs mkhas pas kyang ston par byed do //
analyzed: yang na thabs mkhas pas kyang ston par byed do //
translated: Or he teaches with skillful means.

original: sems can nyes par spyad pa spyod pa rnams kyi nyes par spyod pa spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can nyes par spyad pa spyod pa rnams kyi nyes par spyod pa spang ba'i phyir /
translated: For sentient beings who engage in negative actions, he teaches the Dharma in order to abandon negative actions.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du ser sna can rnams kyi ser sna spang ba dang / tshe 'di la yang dag pa dang / tshogs chung ngus longs spyod rnams @79a * //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du ser sna can rnams kyi ser sna spang ba dang / tshe 'di la yang dag pa dang / tshogs chung ngus longs spyod rnams @79a * //
translated: In the same way, he teaches the Dharma in order to abandon stinginess for those who are stingy, and in order to abandon the afflictions for those who are afflicted.

original: bsgrub pa dang / bsrung ba dang / bstan pa 'di la lta ba rnams dad pa thob bar bya ba dang / lta ba rnam par dag pas ngan song las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba dang / kun tu sbyor ba thams cad mthar thug pas sdug bsngal thams cad las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bsgrub pa dang / bsrung ba dang / bstan pa 'di la lta ba rnams dad pa thob bar bya ba dang / lta ba rnam par dag pas ngan song las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba dang / kun tu sbyor ba thams cad mthar thug pas sdug bsngal thams cad las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies to the practice, the observance, and the view of this teaching, in order to attain faith, in order to transcend the miserable destinies by means of a pure view, and in order to transcend all suffering by means of the final abandonment of all fetters.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni phan 'dogs pa'i sems can rnams la byas pa gzo ba ston pa'i tshe mthong na gus par byas te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni phan 'dogs pa'i sems can rnams la byas pa gzo ba ston pa'i tshe mthong na gus par byas te /
translated: Moreover, when a bodhisattva shows gratitude to those beings who have helped him, he sees them with respect.

original: tshur spyon legs par byon to zhes brjod pas smra zhing kun tu smra la /
analyzed: tshur spyon legs par byon to zhes brjod pas smra zhing kun tu smra la /
translated: He speaks to them and converses with them, saying, ‚ÄúWelcome!

original: yang dag par dga' bar byed /
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar byed /
translated: He delights them.

original: stan dang gnas sbyin pas kyang bsu bar byed do //
analyzed: stan dang gnas sbyin pas kyang bsu bar byed do //
translated: He receives them by offering them a seat and a place to stay.

original: de'i rnyed pa dang / bkur sti'i lan de dang mnyam pa dang / lhag par nye bar gnas par byed kyi /
analyzed: de'i rnyed pa dang / bkur sti'i lan de dang mnyam pa dang / lhag par nye bar gnas par byed kyi /
translated: He repays their acquisition and honor with something equal to or greater than it,

original: chung ngus ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chung ngus ni ma yin no //
translated: but not with something less.

original: de bya ba rnams la ni ma bcol bar grogs su 'gro la bcol na lta ci smos /
analyzed: de bya ba rnams la ni ma bcol bar grogs su 'gro la bcol na lta ci smos /
translated: In all activities, he or she is a companion without being asked, let alone when asked.

original: bya ba rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du sdug bsngal ba rnams dang / tshul bzhin du bstan pa dang / 'jigs pa'i skyabs bya ba dang / sdug bsngal bar gnas pa mya ngan bsal ba dang / yo byad nye bar sgrub pa dang / gnas sbyin pa dang /
analyzed: bya ba rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du sdug bsngal ba rnams dang / tshul bzhin du bstan pa dang / 'jigs pa'i skyabs bya ba dang / sdug bsngal bar gnas pa mya ngan bsal ba dang / yo byad nye bar sgrub pa dang / gnas sbyin pa dang /
translated: Just as with activities, he or she is a companion in suffering, in proper instruction, in providing protection from fear, in dispelling the sorrow of those who are in pain, in providing necessities, and in giving a home.

original: sems dang mthun par bya ba dang / yang dag pa'i yon tan gyis dga' bar bya ba dang / nang gi sems 'jam pos tshar gcad pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyis skrag par bya ba dang / 'dun par bya ba la yang de dang 'dra bar sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩyang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can 'jigs pa rnams 'jigs pa dag las srung bar byed do //
analyzed: sems dang mthun par bya ba dang / yang dag pa'i yon tan gyis dga' bar bya ba dang / nang gi sems 'jam pos tshar gcad pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyis skrag par bya ba dang / 'dun par bya ba la yang de dang 'dra bar sbyar bar bya'o // yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can 'jigs pa rnams 'jigs pa dag las srung bar byed do //
translated: He or she is a companion in the mind, in delighting with true good qualities, in gentle inner attitude, in frightening with miracles, and in attracting.üîΩMoreover, a bodhisattva protects sentient beings from the fear of the hells.

original: gcan gzan gyi gnod pa'i 'jigs pa las kyang sems can rnams srung ngo //
analyzed: gcan gzan gyi gnod pa'i 'jigs pa las kyang sems can rnams srung ngo //
translated: He or she protects sentient beings from the fear of harm by wild animals.

original: klong dang chu srin 'dzin khri'i 'jigs pa dang / rgyal po'i 'jigs pa dang / chom rkun gyi 'jigs pa dang / phyir rgol bas 'jigs pa dang / rje bo dang bdag po'i 'jigs pa dang / 'tsho ba med pa'i 'jigs pa dang / mi snyan pa'i 'jigs pa dang /
analyzed: klong dang chu srin 'dzin khri'i 'jigs pa dang / rgyal po'i 'jigs pa dang / chom rkun gyi 'jigs pa dang / phyir rgol bas 'jigs pa dang / rje bo dang bdag po'i 'jigs pa dang / 'tsho ba med pa'i 'jigs pa dang / mi snyan pa'i 'jigs pa dang /
translated: He protects from the fear of the ocean, the fear of sea monsters, the fear of kings, the fear of robbers, the fear of enemies, the fear of masters and owners, the fear of lack of livelihood, the fear of disrepute,

original: 'khor du bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pa dang / mi ma yin pa'i 'jigs pa dang / ro langs kyi 'jigs pa las kyang srung bar byed do //
analyzed: 'khor du bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pa dang / mi ma yin pa'i 'jigs pa dang / ro langs kyi 'jigs pa las kyang srung bar byed do //
translated: the fear of being timid in the assembly, the fear of non-human beings, and the fear of zombies.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can sdug bsngal zhing 'dug pa rnams kyi mya ngan sel bar byed de /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can sdug bsngal zhing 'dug pa rnams kyi mya ngan sel bar byed de /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva dispels the sorrow of sentient beings who are suffering.

original: gnyen bshes kyi sdug bsngal las brtsams te @79b pha ma shi na yang mya ngan sel bar byed do //
analyzed: gnyen bshes kyi sdug bsngal las brtsams te @79b pha ma shi na yang mya ngan sel bar byed do //
translated: Starting from the sorrow of relatives, he dispels the sorrow of the death of parents.

original: bu dang chung ma shi ba dang / bran dang bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba shi ba dang / mdza' bshes dang / gros grogs dang / nye du dang / rgan rabs shi ba dang / slob dpon dang /
analyzed: bu dang chung ma shi ba dang / bran dang bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba shi ba dang / mdza' bshes dang / gros grogs dang / nye du dang / rgan rabs shi ba dang / slob dpon dang /
translated: the death of his sons and wives, the death of his servants, male and female, and of his workers and employees, the death of his friends, companions, relatives, and elders, the death of his teachers,üîΩ

original: mkhan po dang / bla ma lta bu shi na yang mya ngan sel bar byed do //üîΩyang longs spyod kyi sdug bsngal las brtsams te /
analyzed: mkhan po dang / bla ma lta bu shi na yang mya ngan sel bar byed do // yang longs spyod kyi sdug bsngal las brtsams te /
translated: He will console them when their sons and wives die, when their male and female servants, their workers and employees die, when their friends, advisors, relatives, and elders die, when their teachers, preceptors, and venerable gurus die.üîΩHe will console them when they suffer from the loss of wealth.

original: gal te gzhan dag gi longs spyod rgyal pos phrogs na yang de la mya ngan sel bar byed do //üîΩchom rkun gyis phrogs par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: gal te gzhan dag gi longs spyod rgyal pos phrogs na yang de la mya ngan sel bar byed do // chom rkun gyis phrogs par gyur pa'am /
translated: If others‚Äô wealth is confiscated by the king, he will console them.üîΩIf it is stolen by thieves,

original: mes tshig gam /
analyzed: mes tshig gam /
translated: if it is destroyed by fire,

original: chus khyer ram /
analyzed: chus khyer ram /
translated: if it is carried away by water,

original: gter dag tu legs par ma sbas pas chud zos pa'am /
analyzed: gter dag tu legs par ma sbas pas chud zos pa'am /
translated: if it is lost because it is not well hidden as treasure,

original: las rnams nan tan du ma byas pas ma rungs pas gyur pa'am /
analyzed: las rnams nan tan du ma byas pas ma rungs pas gyur pa'am /
translated: if it is ruined because the work is not done properly,

original: bgo skal la spyod pa mi 'dza' ba rnams kyis khyer bar gyur ba'am /
analyzed: bgo skal la spyod pa mi 'dza' ba rnams kyis khyer bar gyur ba'am /
translated: if it is taken away by relatives who are not generous,

original: khyim du khyim gyi phung khrol byung bar gyur ba'am /
analyzed: khyim du khyim gyi phung khrol byung bar gyur ba'am /
translated: Or, when there is a family problem in the home,

original: gang gis longs spyod de dag la tshul ma yin pas sdug bsngal byas par gyur te /
analyzed: gang gis longs spyod de dag la tshul ma yin pas sdug bsngal byas par gyur te /
translated: or when those resources are made into a cause of suffering through improper use,

original: gzhi de las sems can rnams kyi mya ngan chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po rnams skyes pa yang byang chub sems dpas yang dag par sel bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhi de las sems can rnams kyi mya ngan chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po rnams skyes pa yang byang chub sems dpas yang dag par sel bar byed do //
translated: then the bodhisattva will properly remove the lesser, middling, and greater sorrows of those beings that arise from that cause.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni yo byad 'dod pa rnams la yo byad sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni yo byad 'dod pa rnams la yo byad sgrub par byed de /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva provides resources to those who want resources.

original: zas 'dod pa rnams la zas sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: zas 'dod pa rnams la zas sbyin par byed do //
translated: He gives food to those who want food.

original: skom 'dod pa rnams la skom dang / bzhon pa 'dod pa rnams la bzhon pa dang / gos 'dod pa rnams la gos dang / rgyan 'dod pa rnams la rgyan dang / snod spyad 'dod pa rnams la snod spyad dang / spos dang me tog phreng dang /
analyzed: skom 'dod pa rnams la skom dang / bzhon pa 'dod pa rnams la bzhon pa dang / gos 'dod pa rnams la gos dang / rgyan 'dod pa rnams la rgyan dang / snod spyad 'dod pa rnams la snod spyad dang / spos dang me tog phreng dang /
translated: He gives drink to those who want drink, vehicles to those who want vehicles, clothes to those who want clothes, ornaments to those who want ornaments, utensils to those who want utensils, perfumes and ointments to those who want perfumes and ointments, flowers, garlands,

original: byug pa 'dod pa rnams la spos dang / me tog phreng dang / byug pa dang / gnas 'dod pa rnams la gnas dang / snang ba 'dod pa rnams la snang ba 'dod pa rnams la snang ba sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: byug pa 'dod pa rnams la spos dang / me tog phreng dang / byug pa dang / gnas 'dod pa rnams la gnas dang / snang ba 'dod pa rnams la snang ba 'dod pa rnams la snang ba sbyin par byed do //
translated: He gives perfume, garlands, ointments, and unguents to those who desire them; he gives dwellings to those who desire a dwelling, and light to those who desire light.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni yongs su sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyis sems can rnams tshogs yongs su bsdu ba'i tshul gyis yongs su sdud par byed de ;
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni yongs su sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyis sems can rnams tshogs yongs su bsdu ba'i tshul gyis yongs su sdud par byed de ;
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva, by means of the morality of collecting, collects sentient beings by means of collecting the stores.

original: snying brtse ba'i sems kho na sngon du btang ste /
analyzed: snying brtse ba'i sems kho na sngon du btang ste /
translated: He first generates the thought of compassion.

original: zang zing med pa'i sems kyis thog mar je gnas sbyin par byed do //üîΩde'i 'og tu de dag gi don gyi phyir bram ze dang / khyim bdag dad pa can rnams las chos bzhin du gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos @80a * //
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i sems kyis thog mar je gnas sbyin par byed do // de'i 'og tu de dag gi don gyi phyir bram ze dang / khyim bdag dad pa can rnams las chos bzhin du gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos @80a * //
translated: With a mind free of material desires, he first gives the gift of the Dharma.

original: sman dang / yo byad rnams tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: sman dang / yo byad rnams tshol bar byed do //
translated: Then, for their sake, he seeks, in accordance with the Dharma, robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicine for the sick, from faithful brahmins and laypeople.

original: rang gi gos dang / zas dang mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byas chos dang mthun zhing chos bzhin du rnyed pa rnams kyang thun mong du longs spyod par byed de /
analyzed: rang gi gos dang / zas dang mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byas chos dang mthun zhing chos bzhin du rnyed pa rnams kyang thun mong du longs spyod par byed de /
translated: He also shares with them his own robes, food, bedding, seats, medicine for curing the ill, and personal belongings, which he has acquired in ways that accord with the Dharma and in accordance with the Dharma.

original: sbed cing spyod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sbed cing spyod pa ma yin no //
translated: He does not hoard and then use them.

original: dus dus su mthun pa'i gdams ngag rnam pa brgyad kyang sbyin par byed la /
analyzed: dus dus su mthun pa'i gdams ngag rnam pa brgyad kyang sbyin par byed la /
translated: From time to time, he also gives the eight kinds of timely advice.

original: rjes su bstan pa rnam pa lnga yang rjes su ston par byed do //
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa rnam pa lnga yang rjes su ston par byed do //
translated: He also gives the five kinds of instruction.

original: gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa ni stobs kyi rigs kyi le'u las ji skad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa ni stobs kyi rigs kyi le'u las ji skad bstan pa yin te /
translated: The advice and instruction are as described in the chapter on the spiritual lineages of the powers.

original: 'dir yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as they are presented there.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems dang mthun par byed pa'i tshul khrims kyis sems can rnams kyi sems dang mthun par byed pa na /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems dang mthun par byed pa'i tshul khrims kyis sems can rnams kyi sems dang mthun par byed pa na /
translated: Moreover, when a bodhisattva, through the morality of acting in accord with what he has said, acts in accord with the minds of sentient beings,

original: thog ma kho nar sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dang / rang bzhin dang / khams shes so //
analyzed: thog ma kho nar sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dang / rang bzhin dang / khams shes so //
translated: he first of all understands the thoughts, natures, and dispositions of sentient beings.

original: bsam pa dang / rang bzhin dang / khams shes nas sems can gang dag dang ji ltar lhan cig gnas par bya ba da ltar de dag dang gnas so //
analyzed: bsam pa dang / rang bzhin dang / khams shes nas sems can gang dag dang ji ltar lhan cig gnas par bya ba da ltar de dag dang gnas so //
translated: Having understood their intentions, natures, and dispositions, he now lives with those sentient beings in whatever way is appropriate.

original: sems can gang dag la ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba de ltar de dag la sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: sems can gang dag la ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba de ltar de dag la sgrub par byed do //
translated: He now accomplishes those sentient beings in whatever way is appropriate.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gang gi sems dang mthun par byed 'dod par gyur pa de la gal te lus dang ngag gi dngos po kun tu spyod pa de lta bu de 'dra bas de'i sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba skye bar mthong la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gang gi sems dang mthun par byed 'dod par gyur pa de la gal te lus dang ngag gi dngos po kun tu spyod pa de lta bu de 'dra bas de'i sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba skye bar mthong la /
translated: If a bodhisattva sees that a certain sentient being would generate suffering and mental unhappiness due to a certain kind of physical or verbal conduct,

original: sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba des kyang de mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslangs te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba des kyang de mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslangs te /
translated: and if that suffering and mental unhappiness would not cause that person to turn away from opportunities for nonvirtue and

original: dge ba'i gnas su 'jog par mi 'gyur na ni byang chub sems dpas so sor brtags nas lus dang ngag gis kun tu spyod pa de bsgrims te yongs su spong zhing kun tu spyod par mi byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i gnas su 'jog par mi 'gyur na ni byang chub sems dpas so sor brtags nas lus dang ngag gis kun tu spyod pa de bsgrims te yongs su spong zhing kun tu spyod par mi byed do //
translated: to become established in opportunities for virtue, then the bodhisattva should carefully avoid that kind of physical and verbal conduct after careful consideration, and should not engage in it.

original: gal te sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba des kyang de mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslangs te dge ba'i gnas su 'jog par mthong na ni /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba des kyang de mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslangs te dge ba'i gnas su 'jog par mthong na ni /
translated: If he sees that the other‚Äôs suffering and mental pain will cause him to turn away from opportunities for nonvirtue and to be established in opportunities for virtue,

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'di lta ste /
translated: then the bodhisattva,

original: gzhan la snying brtse ba kho na nye bar bzung nas so sor brtags te /
analyzed: gzhan la snying brtse ba kho na nye bar bzung nas so sor brtags te /
translated: having considered it well,

original: gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par mi byed do //üîΩgzhan dag las lus dang / ngag gi dngos po kun tu spyod pa gang gis gzhan dag gi sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba skye bar 'gyur la de yang gzhan dag dang / de las gzhan pa rnams mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslangs @80b te ;
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par mi byed do // gzhan dag las lus dang / ngag gi dngos po kun tu spyod pa gang gis gzhan dag gi sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba skye bar 'gyur la de yang gzhan dag dang / de las gzhan pa rnams mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslangs @80b te ;
translated: does not comply with the other‚Äôs mind.

original: dge ba'i gnas su 'jog par mi 'gyur na yang /
analyzed: dge ba'i gnas su 'jog par mi 'gyur na yang /
translated: If he sees that the other‚Äôs suffering and mental pain will not cause him to turn away from opportunities for nonvirtue and to be established in opportunities for virtue,üîΩthen the bodhisattva,

original: byang chub sems dpas so sor brtags te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas so sor brtags te /
translated: having considered it well,

original: de las gzhan pa rnams kyi sems dang mthun par mi bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rnams kyi sems dang mthun par mi bya ba'i phyir /
translated: does not comply with the other‚Äôs mind.

original: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa de gtong bar byed do //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa de gtong bar byed do //
translated: He gives up that bodily or verbal conduct that causes suffering and mental pain to others,üîΩeven though it does not cause others and those around them to turn away from opportunities for nonvirtue and to be established in opportunities for virtue.

original: gal te gzhan dag dang de las gzhan pa rnams sam /
analyzed: gal te gzhan dag dang de las gzhan pa rnams sam /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is the difference between the two?‚ÄùüîΩ

original: de gnyi ga mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslangs te /
analyzed: de gnyi ga mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslangs te /
translated: If he sees that others are being led out of nonvirtue and being established in virtue,

original: dge ba'i gnas su 'jog par mthong na ni byang chub sems dpas snying brtse ba'i sems kho na nye bar bzhag ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i gnas su 'jog par mthong na ni byang chub sems dpas snying brtse ba'i sems kho na nye bar bzhag ste /
translated: then the bodhisattva, having thoroughly investigated with a mind of compassion,

original: so sor brtags nas lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod par byed de /
analyzed: so sor brtags nas lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod par byed de /
translated: will engage in physical and verbal conduct.

original: sems can de dag gi sems dang mthun par mi byed do //
analyzed: sems can de dag gi sems dang mthun par mi byed do //
translated: He will not act in accordance with the minds of those sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag nyid kyi lus dang ngag gis dngos po kun tu spyod pa gang gis pha rol dag gi sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba skye bar yang dag par mthong la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag nyid kyi lus dang ngag gis dngos po kun tu spyod pa gang gis pha rol dag gi sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba skye bar yang dag par mthong la /
translated: The bodhisattva sees that, through his own physical and verbal conduct, others will experience suffering and mental unhappiness.

original: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa de yang bslab pa'i gzhir gtogs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa de yang bslab pa'i gzhir gtogs pa yang ma yin /
translated: That physical and verbal conduct is not included in the bases of training.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not endowed with the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba des kyang gzhan dag mi dge ba'i gnas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba des kyang gzhan dag mi dge ba'i gnas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: And by that suffering and mental dissatisfaction, he should understand that others are being turned away from opportunities for nonvirtue, and so on, as before.

original: gzhan gyi sems bsrung ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa de gtong bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems bsrung ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa de gtong bar byed do //
translated: For the sake of protecting the minds of others, the bodhisattva gives up that kind of physical and verbal conduct.

original: de las bzlog pa'i kun tu spyod pa yang snga ma bzhin du rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i kun tu spyod pa yang snga ma bzhin du rigs par bya'o //
translated: The opposite kind of conduct should be understood as before.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang yi mi bde ba ji lta ba bzhin du bde ba dang yid bde ba yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang yi mi bde ba ji lta ba bzhin du bde ba dang yid bde ba yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as with suffering and mental dissatisfaction, so also with pleasure and mental satisfaction.

original: ci rigs par rgyas par rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: ci rigs par rgyas par rigs par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood in detail according to the circumstances.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par byed pa ni gzhan kho ba'i kun nas dkris pas kun nas dkris pa la khro ba'i kun nas dkris pa med par ma gyur gyi bar du mngon sum du bsngags pa yang mi brjod na bsngags pa ma yin
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par byed pa ni gzhan kho ba'i kun nas dkris pas kun nas dkris pa la khro ba'i kun nas dkris pa med par ma gyur gyi bar du mngon sum du bsngags pa yang mi brjod na bsngags pa ma yin
translated: The bodhisattva who is in harmony with the minds of others does not praise in his presence someone who is hostile toward him until he has given up that hostility.

original: pa lta ci smos te shad kyis sbyang bar me byed do //
analyzed: pa lta ci smos te shad kyis sbyang bar me byed do //
translated: what need is there to mention the case of those who are not angry?

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par byed pa ni /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par byed pa ni /
translated: Moreover, a bodhisattva who is in harmony with the minds of others

original: gzhan mi smra ba la yang smra zhing yang dag par dga' bar byed na /
analyzed: gzhan mi smra ba la yang smra zhing yang dag par dga' bar byed na /
translated: will speak and will truly delight even those who are not speaking and who are not delighted.

original: smra ba dang yang dag par dga' bar byed pa lta la ci smos /
analyzed: smra ba dang yang dag par dga' bar byed pa lta la ci smos /
translated: What need is there to mention the case of those who are speaking and who are delighted?

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par byed pa ni gzhan dag la 'khrug par mi byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par byed pa ni gzhan dag la 'khrug par mi byed de /
translated: A bodhisattva who is in harmony with the minds of others will not quarrel with others.

original: de dag nyid la snying brtse ba'i phyir sma dbab par 'dod par @81a * //
analyzed: de dag nyid la snying brtse ba'i phyir sma dbab par 'dod par @81a * //
translated: He will only wish to admonish them out of compassion for them,

original: zad de ; dbang po rnams rab tu zhi bas sma 'bebs par byed do //
analyzed: zad de ; dbang po rnams rab tu zhi bas sma 'bebs par byed do //
translated: and he will admonish them with his faculties tranquil.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par byed pa ni gzhan dag la 'phya bar yang mi byed /üîΩbsting bar yang mi byed la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par byed pa ni gzhan dag la 'phya bar yang mi byed / bsting bar yang mi byed la /
translated: A bodhisattva who is in harmony with the minds of others will not ridicule othersüîΩor make fun of them.

original: de bag 'khums par mi byed do //
analyzed: de bag 'khums par mi byed do //
translated: He will not humiliate them.

original: bde ba la reg par mi gnas par bya ba'i phyir the tshom slong bar yang mi byed do //
analyzed: bde ba la reg par mi gnas par bya ba'i phyir the tshom slong bar yang mi byed do //
translated: He does not cause doubt in order to make them unhappy.

original: chad pas bcad cing sma bab zin pa la yang chad pa'i gnas kyis gleng bar mi byed do //
analyzed: chad pas bcad cing sma bab zin pa la yang chad pa'i gnas kyis gleng bar mi byed do //
translated: He does not bring up past mistakes in order to punish or humiliate.

original: dga' ba'i shas chung ba la yang bdag nyid mtho bar mi ston to //
analyzed: dga' ba'i shas chung ba la yang bdag nyid mtho bar mi ston to //
translated: He does not show off his own greatness to those who are less enthusiastic.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par byed pa ni gzhan dag la mi bsten par yang mi byed /üîΩha cang bsten par yang mi byed /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par byed pa ni gzhan dag la mi bsten par yang mi byed / ha cang bsten par yang mi byed /
translated: The bodhisattva acts in harmony with the minds of others. He does not neglect others.üîΩHe does not favor some over others.

original: dus ma yin par yang bsten par yang mi byed /üîΩde dag gi mdun du mdza' bo la smod par yang mi byed /
analyzed: dus ma yin par yang bsten par yang mi byed / de dag gi mdun du mdza' bo la smod par yang mi byed /
translated: He does not favor some times over others.üîΩHe does not criticize friends in front of them.

original: mi mdza' ba'i bsngags pa yang mi brjod /
analyzed: mi mdza' ba'i bsngags pa yang mi brjod /
translated: He does not praise enemies behind their backs.

original: ma 'dris pa la yid rton par yang mi byed /
analyzed: ma 'dris pa la yid rton par yang mi byed /
translated: He does not trust those who are not friends.

original: rgyun du slong bar yang mi byed /
analyzed: rgyun du slong bar yang mi byed /
translated: He does not constantly beg.

original: blang ba la yang tshod shes pa yin /
analyzed: blang ba la yang tshod shes pa yin /
translated: He knows the proper amount to take.

original: zas dang skom la sogs pa la bos na yang spong bar mi byed do //
analyzed: zas dang skom la sogs pa la bos na yang spong bar mi byed do //
translated: He does not refuse food and drink, etc., when invited.

original: yang na chos dang mthun par shad kyis byang bar byed do //
analyzed: yang na chos dang mthun par shad kyis byang bar byed do //
translated: or he makes them understand in a way that is in accordance with the Dharma.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni yang dag pa'i yon tan gyis yang dag par dga' bar bya ba'i tshul khrims kyis sems can rnams yang dag par dga' bar byed pa na /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni yang dag pa'i yon tan gyis yang dag par dga' bar bya ba'i tshul khrims kyis sems can rnams yang dag par dga' bar byed pa na /
translated: Moreover, when the bodhisattva, by means of the morality of delighting others with his own virtues, delights sentient beings,

original: dad pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la ni dad pa'i yon tan gyi 'brel ba'i gtam gyis yang dag par dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: dad pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la ni dad pa'i yon tan gyi 'brel ba'i gtam gyis yang dag par dga' bar byed do //
translated: he delights those who have the virtue of faith with a discourse that is connected with the virtue of faith.

original: tshul khrims kyi yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la ni tshul khrims kyi yon tan gyi 'brel ba'i gtam gyis yang dag par dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la ni tshul khrims kyi yon tan gyi 'brel ba'i gtam gyis yang dag par dga' bar byed do //
translated: He delights those who have the virtue of morality with a discourse that is connected with the virtue of morality.

original: / thos pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la ni thos pa'i yon tan gyi 'brel ba'i gtam gyis yang dag par dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: / thos pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la ni thos pa'i yon tan gyi 'brel ba'i gtam gyis yang dag par dga' bar byed do //
translated: He delights those who have the virtue of learning with a discourse that is connected with the virtue of learning.

original: gtang ba'i yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la ni gtong ba'i yon tan gyi 'brel ba'i gtam gyis yang dag par dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: gtang ba'i yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la ni gtong ba'i yon tan gyi 'brel ba'i gtam gyis yang dag par dga' bar byed do //
translated: He delights them with talk about the virtues of generosity, in the case of those who have the virtues of generosity.

original: shes rab kyi yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la ni shes rab kyi yon tan gyi 'brel ba'i gtam gyis yang dag par dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la ni shes rab kyi yon tan gyi 'brel ba'i gtam gyis yang dag par dga' bar byed do //
translated: He delights them with talk about the virtues of wisdom, in the case of those who have the virtues of wisdom.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni tshar gcod pa'i tshul khrims kyis sems can rnams tshar gcod par byed de /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni tshar gcod pa'i tshul khrims kyis sems can rnams tshar gcod par byed de /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva disciplines sentient beings through the morality of punishment.

original: nyes pa chung ngu dang / 'gal ba chung ngu la ni bsam pa 'jam po dang sdang ba @81b med pas sma dbab pa chung ngus sma 'bebs par byed do //
analyzed: nyes pa chung ngu dang / 'gal ba chung ngu la ni bsam pa 'jam po dang sdang ba @81b med pas sma dbab pa chung ngus sma 'bebs par byed do //
translated: For minor faults and minor transgressions, he disciplines them with a minor scolding, with a gentle attitude and without anger.

original: nyes pa 'bring dang / 'gal ba 'bring la ni sma dbab pa 'bring gis sma 'bebs par byed do //
analyzed: nyes pa 'bring dang / 'gal ba 'bring la ni sma dbab pa 'bring gis sma 'bebs par byed do //
translated: For middling faults and middling transgressions, he disciplines them with a middling scolding.

original: nyes pa chen po dang 'gal ba chen po la sma dbab pa chen pos sma 'bebs par byed do //
analyzed: nyes pa chen po dang 'gal ba chen po la sma dbab pa chen pos sma 'bebs par byed do //
translated: For great faults and great transgressions, he disciplines them with a great scolding.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blang bar 'dod pa la snga nas byang chub sems dpa'i mdo sde'i sde snod kyi ma mo 'di las byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i gzhi dang / nyes pa'i gnas gang dag bstan pa de dag bsgrag par bya ste ;
translated: For a bodhisattva who wishes to take up the restraint of the bodhisattva morality, this very text of the bodhisattva canon should be recited beforehand, in which the bases of bodhisattva training and the grounds for downfall are taught.

original: gal te snying nas brtags shing shes rab kyis so sor brtags nas /üîΩspros par gyur la pha rol gyis yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa'i phyir yang ma yin /
analyzed: gal te snying nas brtags shing shes rab kyis so sor brtags nas / spros par gyur la pha rol gyis yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa'i phyir yang ma yin /
translated: If, after careful consideration and discernment with wisdom,üîΩhe does not take it up out of pride, or because he is not urged to do so by others,

original: pha rol dang 'gran pa'i phyir yang ma yin na /
analyzed: pha rol dang 'gran pa'i phyir yang ma yin na /
translated: or because he is competing with others,

original: byang chub sems dpa' brtan po yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' brtan po yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: then he should be known as a steadfast bodhisattva.

original: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blang ba 'di cho ga 'di bzhin du des kyang ma nod par bya zhing de la dbog par yang bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blang ba 'di cho ga 'di bzhin du des kyang ma nod par bya zhing de la dbog par yang bya'o //
translated: This taking up of the restraint of the bodhisattva morality should be done by him in this very manner, and it should be conferred upon him in this very manner.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi sdom pa la gnas pa'i phas pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos bzhi yod de /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi sdom pa la gnas pa'i phas pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos bzhi yod de /
translated: They are:

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par zhen te /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par zhen te /
translated: To be attached to gain and honor and

original: bdag la bstod pa dang / gzhan la smod pa byang chub sems dpa'i phas pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos dang / longs spyod dag yod de /
analyzed: bdag la bstod pa dang / gzhan la smod pa byang chub sems dpa'i phas pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos dang / longs spyod dag yod de /
translated: to praise oneself and disparage others is a bodhisattva's ground of defeat.

original: bdog bzhin du chags pa'i rang bzhin gyi sdug bsngal ba dang / bkren pa dang / mgon med pa dang / rten med pa'i slong ba po legs par 'ongs pa rnams la snying @85b sra bas zang zing mi gtong ba dang / chos la ser sna byed pa'i phyir don du gnyer ba legs par 'ongs pa rnams la chos kyi bgo bsha' mi byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos dang /
analyzed: bdog bzhin du chags pa'i rang bzhin gyi sdug bsngal ba dang / bkren pa dang / mgon med pa dang / rten med pa'i slong ba po legs par 'ongs pa rnams la snying @85b sra bas zang zing mi gtong ba dang / chos la ser sna byed pa'i phyir don du gnyer ba legs par 'ongs pa rnams la chos kyi bgo bsha' mi byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos dang /
translated: To have possessions and yet not give material things out of a nature of attachment to those who have come properly, who are suffering, who are poor, who are unprotected, and who are without support, and to not share the Dharma with those who properly come seeking it out of stinginess with the Dharma is a bodhisattva's ground of defeat.

original: gang gis byang chub sems dpa'i tshig rtsub pos smras pa tsam gyis gtong bar mi byed de /
analyzed: gang gis byang chub sems dpa'i tshig rtsub pos smras pa tsam gyis gtong bar mi byed de /
translated: Because of that, a bodhisattva does not give up on someone who has spoken harshly to him or her.

original: khro bo'i kun nas dkris pa de lta bu 'phel bar byed la /
analyzed: khro bo'i kun nas dkris pa de lta bu 'phel bar byed la /
translated: He or she does not allow such an angry state of mind to increase.

original: khro bas zil gyis non nas /üîΩlag pa'am / bong ba'am /
analyzed: khro bas zil gyis non nas / lag pa'am / bong ba'am /
translated: Overcome by anger,üîΩhe or she strikes sentient beings with the hand, or with a stick,

original: dbyung ba sems can rnams la rdeg par byed /üîΩrnam par 'tshe bar byed /
analyzed: dbyung ba sems can rnams la rdeg par byed / rnam par 'tshe bar byed /
translated: or with a clod of earth,üîΩor he or she injures them,

original: rnam par tho 'tshams par byed pa la /
analyzed: rnam par tho 'tshams par byed pa la /
translated: or he or she torments them.

original: gzhan dag gis 'gal bshad kyis sbyangs kyang khro ba'i bsam pas bsngo ba'i kho na zhal bzung ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis 'gal bshad kyis sbyangs kyang khro ba'i bsam pas bsngo ba'i kho na zhal bzung ste /
translated: Even though others may remonstrate with him or her, because of the attitude of anger, he or she persists in the same evil course of conduct,üîΩdoes not listen, does not accept their advice, and does not give up that attitude.

original: mi nyan cing mi bzod la bsam pas mi gtong ba 'di yang byang chub sems dpa'i pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la skur ba btab pas 'debs pa dang / bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: mi nyan cing mi bzod la bsam pas mi gtong ba 'di yang byang chub sems dpa'i pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la skur ba btab pas 'debs pa dang / bdag nyid dam /
translated: This is also a bodhisattva‚Äôs defeat-like offense that is a fundamental transgression of the bodhisattva training, because it is a denigration of the canon of the bodhisattva training.

original: gzhan dag gis g-yam la dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa la mos nas dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa rnams la dga' ba dang / ston pa dang / 'jog pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis g-yam la dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa la mos nas dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa rnams la dga' ba dang / ston pa dang / 'jog pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: Others, who are devoted to counterfeits of the Dharma, delight in, teach, and establish those counterfeits.

original: bzhi po de dag ni pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos rnams yin te /
analyzed: bzhi po de dag ni pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos rnams yin te /
translated: These four are the dharmas that are like the grounds for defeat.

original: de dag las byang chub sems dpas chos gang yang rung ba byas na yang tshe 'di la byang chub kyi tshogs rgya chen po sogs pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa'i skal ba med par 'gyur na thams cad la byas na lta ci smos /
analyzed: de dag las byang chub sems dpas chos gang yang rung ba byas na yang tshe 'di la byang chub kyi tshogs rgya chen po sogs pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa'i skal ba med par 'gyur na thams cad la byas na lta ci smos /
translated: If a bodhisattva commits any one of these, he or she will not be able to acquire the great accumulations for enlightenment in this life, let alone all of them.

original: tshe 'di nyid la bsam pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i skal pa yang med de /
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la bsam pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i skal pa yang med de /
translated: And he or she will not be able to purify his or her attitude in this very life.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' ltar bcos pa yin gyi yang dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' ltar bcos pa yin gyi yang dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ma yin no //
translated: Such a person is a counterfeit bodhisattva, not a true bodhisattva.

original: pham pa'i gnas lta bu bzhi po 'di dag gis kun nas dkris pa chung ngu dang / 'bring gis ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa de byang chub sems dpas gtang bar mi 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: pham pa'i gnas lta bu bzhi po 'di dag gis kun nas dkris pa chung ngu dang / 'bring gis ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa de byang chub sems dpas gtang bar mi 'gyur ro ;
translated: By means of the small and medium entanglements, the bodhisattva does not abandon the vow of moral discipline.

original: ; kun nas dkris pa chen pos ni gtang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ; kun nas dkris pa chen pos ni gtang bar 'gyur te /
translated: But by means of the great entanglements, he does abandon it.

original: gang gi byang chub sems dpas pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos bzhi po 'di dag rgyun mi 'chad par kun tu spyod pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa chung ngu tsam yang mi bskyed pa dang / des mgu bar byed cing de @86a * //
analyzed: gang gi byang chub sems dpas pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos bzhi po 'di dag rgyun mi 'chad par kun tu spyod pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa chung ngu tsam yang mi bskyed pa dang / des mgu bar byed cing de @86a * //
translated: If a bodhisattva constantly engages in these four grave offenses, and does not arouse even a small sense of shame or embarrassment, and if he is pleased with that,

original: la dga' ba dang / de nyid la yon tan du lta ba can du gyur pa 'di ni kun nas dkris pa chen po yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: la dga' ba dang / de nyid la yon tan du lta ba can du gyur pa 'di ni kun nas dkris pa chen po yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: and regards it as a good quality, this should be known as the great entanglement.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: pham pa'i chos rnams byas pa'i dge slong gis so sor thar pa'i sdom pa btang bar 'gyur pa bzhin du /
analyzed: pham pa'i chos rnams byas pa'i dge slong gis so sor thar pa'i sdom pa btang bar 'gyur pa bzhin du /
translated: a monk who has committed a defeating offense gives up the vow of individual liberation.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos can lan cig tsam kun tu spyad pas ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa btang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos can lan cig tsam kun tu spyad pas ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa btang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: However, a bodhisattva who has once engaged in a root downfall, a bodhisattva who has a quality that is similar to a root downfall, does not lose the acceptance of the bodhisattva discipline.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni yang dag par blangs pa yongs su btang du zin kyang tshe 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa phyir mnod pa'i skal pa yod de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni yang dag par blangs pa yongs su btang du zin kyang tshe 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa phyir mnod pa'i skal pa yod de /
translated: Even though a bodhisattva has given up the acceptance, he or she still has the opportunity to take up again in this life the acceptance of the bodhisattva discipline.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is so

original: dge slong so sor thar pa'i sdom pa la gnas pa pham pa byung bzhin du skal ba med pa kho nar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dge slong so sor thar pa'i sdom pa la gnas pa pham pa byung bzhin du skal ba med pa kho nar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: just as a fully ordained monk who has incurred a defeating offense does not lose the opportunity to continue to observe the discipline of individual liberation.

original: mdor bsdu na rgyu gnyis kho nas byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa gtang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rgyu gnyis kho nas byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa gtang bar 'gyur te /
translated: In brief, there are two causes for losing the acceptance of the bodhisattva discipline:

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon pa yongs su btang ba dang / pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos kyi kun nas dkris pa chen pos kun tu spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon pa yongs su btang ba dang / pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos kyi kun nas dkris pa chen pos kun tu spyod pa'o //
translated: It is the abandonment of the aspiration for complete and incomparable Awakening, and it is the practice of the great fetters that are the causes of defeat.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang gis smon lam yang ma btang la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang gis smon lam yang ma btang la /
translated: If a bodhisattva does not abandon the aspiration,

original: pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos rnams kyi kun nas dkris pa chen po yang kun tu ma spyad na /üîΩtshe brjes su zin kyang 'og dang steng dang thad ka thams cad du skyes pa nas /
analyzed: pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos rnams kyi kun nas dkris pa chen po yang kun tu ma spyad na / tshe brjes su zin kyang 'og dang steng dang thad ka thams cad du skyes pa nas /
translated: and does not practice the great fetters that are the causes of defeat,

original: byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa spong bar mi 'gyur ro //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' tshe brjes te brjed na yang dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa la brten nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa spong bar mi 'gyur ro // byang chub sems dpa' tshe brjes te brjed na yang dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa la brten nas /
translated: then even if he changes lives, he will not give up the bodhisattva vow of moral discipline, whether he is reborn below, above, or in the same place.üîΩBut if he does forget, then by relying on a spiritual teacher,

analyzed: dran pa gso pa'i phyir yang dang yang nod par byed par zad kyi /
translated: he should restore his mindfulness and take the vow again and again.

original: gsar du yang dag par len pa ni ma yin no //üîΩde ltar byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa la gnas pa'i nyes pa'am /
analyzed: gsar du yang dag par len pa ni ma yin no // de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa la gnas pa'i nyes pa'am /
translated: But he does not newly take up the correct ones.

original: nyes pa ma yin pa dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por yang rig par bya ste /üîΩde ltar byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa la gnas pas nyin gcig @86b bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: nyes pa ma yin pa dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por yang rig par bya ste / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa la gnas pas nyin gcig @86b bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who is established in the bodhisattva morality should know the faults and non-faults, the afflicted and unafflicted, the small, medium, and great.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten nam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten nam /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who is established in the bodhisattva morality should make offerings every day to the Tathagata or to a stupa of the Tathagata,

original: chos sam / chos kyi glegs bam du byas pa /
analyzed: chos sam / chos kyi glegs bam du byas pa /
translated: to the Dharma, or to a book of the Dharma,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mdo sde'i sde snod dam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mdo sde'i sde snod dam /
translated: to the bodhisattva canon,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mdo sde'i sde snod kyi ma mo'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mdo sde'i sde snod kyi ma mo'am /
translated: to the mother of the bodhisattva canon,

original: dge 'dun la yang rung ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun la yang rung ste /
translated: or to the Sangha.

original: phyogs bcu dag na sa chen por chud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge 'dun gang yin pa la mchod pa'i bya ba chud du'am /
analyzed: phyogs bcu dag na sa chen por chud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge 'dun gang yin pa la mchod pa'i bya ba chud du'am /
translated: Whatever the assembly of Bodhisattvas who have entered the great grounds in the ten directions is doing, whether it is a great act of worship or

analyzed: chen po ci yang rung ste / tha na lus kyis phyag gcig tsam 'tshal ba dang / tha na sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun rnams kyi yon tan rnams las brtsams te tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig tsam cig tshig tu brjod pa dang / tha na sems kyis sangs rgyas dang /
translated: whatever else,

original: chos dang / dge 'dun gyi yon tan rjes su dran pa sngon du 'gro ba'i dang pa gcig tsam yang ma byas par nyin mtshan 'da' bar byed na /
analyzed: chos dang / dge 'dun gyi yon tan rjes su dran pa sngon du 'gro ba'i dang pa gcig tsam yang ma byas par nyin mtshan 'da' bar byed na /
translated: even if it is just a single prostration with the body, or even if it is just a single verse of four lines of verse that begins with the qualities of the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha, or even if it is just a single thought that precedes the recollection of the qualities of the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha, if one allows the day and night to pass without doing any of these,

original: nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal pa dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal pa dang bcas par 'gyur te /

analyzed: gal te ma gus pa dang / snyom las dang / le los nyes pa byung na ni /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //

original: gal te brjed pas nyes pa byung na ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i nyes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te brjed pas nyes pa byung na ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i nyes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he commits a transgression through forgetfulness, he commits a transgression that is not a downfall.

original: sems 'khrugs pa la ni nyes pa med do //üîΩbsam pa dag pa'i sar chud pa la nyes pa med de /
analyzed: sems 'khrugs pa la ni nyes pa med do // bsam pa dag pa'i sar chud pa la nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no transgression if he is insane.üîΩThere is no transgression if he has entered the stage of pure superior attitude.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni bsam pa dag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni bsam pa dag pa'i phyir te /
translated: For a bodhisattva who has entered the stage of pure superior attitude, it is impossible to commit a transgression.

original: dper na dge slong gis shes nas dad pa thob pa ni dus thams cad du yang chos nyid kyis ston pa dang / chos dang dge 'dun la bsnyen bkur byed cing mchod pa dam pas mchod pa byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dge slong gis shes nas dad pa thob pa ni dus thams cad du yang chos nyid kyis ston pa dang / chos dang dge 'dun la bsnyen bkur byed cing mchod pa dam pas mchod pa byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is impossible for a fully ordained monk who has attained faith through full confidence in the Dharma to fail to respect the Teacher, the Dharma, and the community at any time, and it is impossible for him to fail to make offerings to the Three Jewels with the highest offerings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'dod pa che ba dang / chog mi shes pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la chags pa byung ba dang du len par byed na /üîΩnyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'dod pa che ba dang / chog mi shes pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la chags pa byung ba dang du len par byed na / nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: If a bodhisattva accepts being greedy, discontented, and attached to possessions and honors,üîΩhe commits an offense and a transgression,

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: and he acquires an afflicted offense.

original: de spang pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyes shing brtson 'grus rtsom la de'i gnyen po yongs su 'dzin pas de'i gags la gnas pa rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa shas che ba'i phyir zil gyis mnan nas yang dang yang du kun tu spyod pa la nyes pa med do
analyzed: de spang pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyes shing brtson 'grus rtsom la de'i gnyen po yongs su 'dzin pas de'i gags la gnas pa rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa shas che ba'i phyir zil gyis mnan nas yang dang yang du kun tu spyod pa la nyes pa med do
translated: There is no fault in repeatedly engaging in such conduct, since one is naturally afflicted by the obstacles to the practice of the antidotes, such as the wish to abandon them and the exertion to do so.üîΩWhen a bodhisattva sees someone older,

original: // byang chub sems dpa' ches rgan zhing yon tan dang ldan la /üîΩbkur @87a * //
analyzed: // byang chub sems dpa' ches rgan zhing yon tan dang ldan la / bkur @87a * //
translated: more accomplished,

original: sti bya bar 'os pa chos mthun pa mthong ba na /
analyzed: sti bya bar 'os pa chos mthun pa mthong ba na /
translated: and worthy of respect who is in accord with the Dharma,

original: nga rgyal gyis non tam /üîΩkun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang ldan nam /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis non tam / kun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang ldan nam /
translated: if he or she does not rise from his or her seat out of pride,

original: khong khro ba'i sems dang ldan yang rung ste /
analyzed: khong khro ba'i sems dang ldan yang rung ste /
translated: or if he or she is in a hostile or angry state of mind,üîΩor if he or she does not offer a seat,

original: langs shing stan mi stobs pa dang / gzhan dag la smra zhing kun tu smra la /
analyzed: langs shing stan mi stobs pa dang / gzhan dag la smra zhing kun tu smra la /

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par ni mi 'gyur ro //üîΩthabs des dul bar bya bar 'dod cing /üîΩ'dul bar 'dod la mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslang ste /
