translated: There is no offense if the bodhisattva is ill and does not do it because of carelessness, laziness, or lack of self-respect.

original: dge ba'i gnas su 'god par 'dod pa na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dge ba'i gnas su 'god par 'dod pa na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the bodhisattva is desirous of taming, desirous of civilizing, desirous of arousing regret, desirous of causing them to turn away from opportunities for wrongdoing and become established in opportunities for virtue.

original: mu stegs can yin na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: mu stegs can yin na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the person is a non-Buddhist.

original: rung ba ma yin pa kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa kun tu spyod pas shad kyis byang ba byed du 'jug par 'dod pa zhig na nyes pa med do //üîΩgal te rang bzhin gyis 'thab krol ba can zhig yin te /üîΩrtsod pa byed la /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa kun tu spyod pas shad kyis byang ba byed du 'jug par 'dod pa zhig na nyes pa med do // gal te rang bzhin gyis 'thab krol ba can zhig yin te / rtsod pa byed la /
translated: There is no offense if the bodhisattva is desirous of causing the person to adopt a practice that is blameless.

original: shad kyis byang bar byas na shas cher 'khrugs te /
analyzed: shad kyis byang bar byas na shas cher 'khrugs te /
translated: There is no offense if the person is by nature quarrelsome and argumentative, and if, by being appeased, he or she would become even more agitated and intractable.

original: shed skye bar 'gyur na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: shed skye bar 'gyur na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the person is a heretic.

original: pha rol bzod pa'i ngang tshul can yin zhing kun nas mnar sems med pa'i ngang tshul can yin du re la gzhan la nyes pa byas pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: pha rol bzod pa'i ngang tshul can yin zhing kun nas mnar sems med pa'i ngang tshul can yin du re la gzhan la nyes pa byas pa las brtsams te /
translated: One hopes that the other is patient and has a forgiving nature.üîΩ

original: shad kyis sbyang ba byed pas shin tu ngo tsha bar byed pa zhig yin na nyes pa med do //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' rtsod pa gang la gzhan nyes pa byung ba dag chos bzhin du mthun par shad kyis byang bar byed kyang /
analyzed: shad kyis sbyang ba byed pas shin tu ngo tsha bar byed pa zhig yin na nyes pa med do // byang chub sems dpa' rtsod pa gang la gzhan nyes pa byung ba dag chos bzhin du mthun par shad kyis byang bar byed kyang /
translated: If the other person is patient and not hostile, and if the bodhisattva is purifying the other person by means of the criticism, there is no fault.üîΩIf the bodhisattva is engaged in a dispute and, although the other person has erred, he or she does not listen to the criticism in accordance with the Dharma,

original: kun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang ldan zhing gzhan la tho @92b 'tshams pa'i bsam pas shad kyis sbyangs pa mi nyan na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang ldan zhing gzhan la tho @92b 'tshams pa'i bsam pas shad kyis sbyangs pa mi nyan na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: then the bodhisattva is at fault and is in conflict with the Dharma,

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //üîΩgal te kun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang mi ldan gyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro // gal te kun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang mi ldan gyi /
translated: and he or she commits an afflicted offense.

original: mi bzod pa'i ngang tshul can yin pas mi nyan na /
analyzed: mi bzod pa'i ngang tshul can yin pas mi nyan na /
translated: If the bodhisattva is not hostile but does not listen because of an impatient attitude,

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: There is an offense of afflicted emotion.

original: thabs des pha rol gdul bar 'dod na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: thabs des pha rol gdul bar 'dod na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the bodhisattva wants to spiritually tame the other person in that way.

original: snga ma bzhin du thams cad rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du thams cad rig par bya'o //
translated: All of this should be understood as it was explained previously.

original: chos bzhin ma yin pa dang / mthun pa ma yin par shad kyis spyod par byed na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: chos bzhin ma yin pa dang / mthun pa ma yin par shad kyis spyod par byed na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the bodhisattva is sick and unable to do the work.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag la khro ba'i bsam pa 'byung zhing 'dzin la byung ba dang du len na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag la khro ba'i bsam pa 'byung zhing 'dzin la byung ba dang du len na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: If a bodhisattva becomes angry and holds a grudge against other bodhisattvas, and does not give up that attitude, he or she commits an offense and a transgression,

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: and there is an offense of afflicted emotion.üîΩThere is no offense if the bodhisattva has given rise to the aspiration to abandon that attitude,

original: de spang pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyes na /
analyzed: de spang pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyes na /
translated: and is making an effort to do so.

original: nyes pa med de snga ma bzhin no /üîΩ// bam po bcu pa /
analyzed: nyes pa med de snga ma bzhin no / // bam po bcu pa /
translated: The rest is the same as before.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rim gro bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba la yongs su zhen pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rim gro bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba la yongs su zhen pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: A bodhisattva who is dominated by a desire for service and honor

original: zang zing dang bcas pa'i sems kyis 'khor sdud par byed na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zang zing dang bcas pa'i sems kyis 'khor sdud par byed na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: If he gathers a retinue with a mind that is worldly, he has transgressed and is in contradiction.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: He has a defiled offense.

original: zang zing med pa'i bsam pas rim gro bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba bdag gir byed na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i bsam pas rim gro bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba bdag gir byed na nyes pa med do //
translated: If he accepts service and respect with a mind that is not worldly, he has no offense.

original: byang chub sems dpa' snyom las dang le lo skyes te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' snyom las dang le lo skyes te /
translated: If a bodhisattva, out of laziness and procrastination,

original: gnyid kyi bde ba dang / nyal ba'i bde ba dang / glos 'bebs pa'i bde ba dus ma yin pa dang / tshod ma yin par bdag gir byed na nyas pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /üîΩnyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyid kyi bde ba dang / nyal ba'i bde ba dang / glos 'bebs pa'i bde ba dus ma yin pa dang / tshod ma yin par bdag gir byed na nyas pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te / nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: accepts the pleasures of sleep, lying down, and reclining at the wrong time and in excess, he has an unafflicted offense.

original: na ste mi nus na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: na ste mi nus na nyes pa med do //
translated: If he is sick and unable to do otherwise, he has no offense.

original: lam gyis dub na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: lam gyis dub na nyes pa med do //
translated: If he is exhausted from travel, he has no offense.

original: de spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyes pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyes pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: If he is striving to abandon sleep, he has no offense.

original: snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as before.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'du 'dzi'i gtam la kun tu chags pa'i sems kyis dus yol bar byed na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'du 'dzi'i gtam la kun tu chags pa'i sems kyis dus yol bar byed na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: If a bodhisattva, with a mind attached to the talk of social interactions, lets the time pass, he has transgressed the bodhisattva vow,

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: and he has a defiled fault.

original: brjed pas yol bar byas na nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //üîΩpha rol smra zhing 'dug la de yang dran pa la gnas bzhin du pha rol gyi ngor skad cig @93a * //
analyzed: brjed pas yol bar byas na nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro // pha rol smra zhing 'dug la de yang dran pa la gnas bzhin du pha rol gyi ngor skad cig @93a * //
translated: If he lets the time pass due to forgetfulness, he has a non-defiled fault.

original: gcig tsam nyan pa la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gcig tsam nyan pa la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: If the other person is talking, and he is listening for just a moment, with his mind focused on the other person, he has no fault.

original: ya mtshan du 'dzin te /
analyzed: ya mtshan du 'dzin te /
translated: If he is listening to a talk that is amazing,

original: 'dri ba tsam dang / dris pa'i lam 'debs pa tsam byed pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'dri ba tsam dang / dris pa'i lam 'debs pa tsam byed pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: or if he is listening to a question and answer session, he has no fault.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems gnas par bya ba las brtsams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems gnas par bya ba las brtsams te /
translated: A bodhisattva, having begun to stabilize his mind,

original: sems mnyam par gzhag par 'dod la /
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag par 'dod la /
translated: if he wishes to rest his mind in meditative equipoise,

original: kun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang ldan pa dang / nga rgyal gyis non te /
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang ldan pa dang / nga rgyal gyis non te /
translated: but is overcome by a hostile mind or by pride,üîΩand

original: gdams ngag nod du mi 'gro na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gdams ngag nod du mi 'gro na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: If he does not go to receive the instruction, he is at fault and in conflict.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: He commits an afflicted offense.

original: snyom las dang le los byas na /
analyzed: snyom las dang le los byas na /
translated: If he does so out of laziness or lack of diligence,

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: he commits an unafflicted offense.

original: na ste mi nus na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: na ste mi nus na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if he is sick and unable to go.

original: gdams ngag log par 'byung du dogs na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gdams ngag log par 'byung du dogs na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if he suspects that the instruction will be incorrect.

original: bdag nyid mang du thos pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid mang du thos pa yin te /
translated: There is no offense if he is himself very learned.

original: sems mnyam par 'jog nus sam /
analyzed: sems mnyam par 'jog nus sam /
translated: There is no offense if he is able to rest evenly in mind itself.

original: des gdams ngag gis gdams pa'i bya ba byas zin na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: des gdams ngag gis gdams pa'i bya ba byas zin na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if he has already done what needs to be done in receiving the instruction.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i sgrib pa byung ba dang du len cing sel bar mi byed na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i sgrib pa byung ba dang du len cing sel bar mi byed na /
translated: If a bodhisattva tolerates and does not dispel the obscurations that are due to longing for sensual pleasures,üîΩhe is at fault and in conflict.

original: nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /üîΩnyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /üîΩnyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: He commits an afflicted offense.

original: de spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyes shing 'bad kyang nyon mongs pa drag pos sems zil gyis non te /
analyzed: de spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyes shing 'bad kyang nyon mongs pa drag pos sems zil gyis non te /
translated: Even though you generate enthusiasm and strive to abandon it, you are overwhelmed by powerful afflictions.

original: kun tu spyod na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: kun tu spyod na nyes pa med do //
translated: Even though he generates will to abandon it and strives, if he is overwhelmed by a strong affliction and engages in it, there is no fault.

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as with will in regard to sensual desire,

original: gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan gyi ro myong bar byed cing bsam gtan gyi ro myong ba la yang yon tan du lta na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o // byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan gyi ro myong bar byed cing bsam gtan gyi ro myong ba la yang yon tan du lta na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: so also with malice, torpor, sleep, excitation, regret, and doubt.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a bodhisattva relishes the taste of meditative concentration and regards that relishing as a virtue, he becomes flawed by a downfall, and he becomes defiled.

original: de spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyes pa la ni nyes pa med de snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyes pa la ni nyes pa med de snga ma bzhin no //
translated: If he generates will to abandon that relishing, there is no fault, as before.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang byang chub sems dpas nyan thos kyi theg pa dang ldan pa'i chos mnyan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang byang chub sems dpas nyan thos kyi theg pa dang ldan pa'i chos mnyan par mi bya'o //
translated: A bodhisattva should not listen to teachings belonging to the way of the disciples.

original: gzung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzung bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not grasp at it.

original: de la bslab par yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la bslab par yang mi bya'o //
translated: One should not train in it.

original: byang chub sems dpas nyan thos kyi theg pa dang ldan pa'i chos mnyan pa dang / bzung bas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas nyan thos kyi theg pa dang ldan pa'i chos mnyan pa dang / bzung bas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What would a bodhisattva do with listening to and grasping at Dharma that belongs to the vehicle of the hearers?

original: de la bslab mi dgos so zhes de ltar lta zhing /
analyzed: de la bslab mi dgos so zhes de ltar lta zhing /
translated: One does not need to train in it.

original: de skad smra na nyes pa dang bcas shing @93b 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur la nyon mongs pa can gyi nyas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de skad smra na nyes pa dang bcas shing @93b 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur la nyon mongs pa can gyi nyas par 'gyur te /
translated: If one were to view and speak in this way, one would be at fault and in error, and one would be morally degenerate.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpas ni mu stegs can gyi bstan bcos rnams la yang brtson par bya dgos na /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpas ni mu stegs can gyi bstan bcos rnams la yang brtson par bya dgos na /
translated: Because bodhisattvas must apply themselves to the treatises of the tƒ´rthikas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab lta la ci smos /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab lta la ci smos /
translated: how much more so to the scriptures of the Buddha.

original: gcig tu nges pa de lhur len pa'i 'dun pa bzlog pa'i phyir na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gcig tu nges pa de lhur len pa'i 'dun pa bzlog pa'i phyir na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if one is trying to turn away the intention of someone who is single-mindedly devoted to that.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod yod la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod yod la /
translated: If a bodhisattva has the bodhisattva canon,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la brtson par ma byas par byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod thams cad kyi thams cad du yang yal bar bor nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la brtson par ma byas par byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod thams cad kyi thams cad du yang yal bar bor nas /
translated: If, without having made an effort in the Bodhisattva canon, he completely abandons the Bodhisattva canon,

original: nyan thos kyi sde snod la brtson par byed na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sde snod la brtson par byed na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: and makes an effort in the ≈örƒÅvaka canon, he commits an offense and a transgression,

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: and he acquires an afflicted offense.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab yod la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab yod la /
translated: If a bodhisattva, while the Buddha-word exists,

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab la brtson pa ma byas par mu stegs can gyi bstan bcos /
translated: makes an effort in the treatises of the tƒ´rthikas,

analyzed: phyi rol gyi bstan bcos dag la brtson par byed na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: or in the treatises of the outsiders, he commits an offense and a transgression,

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: and he acquires an afflicted offense.

original: shin tu yid gzhungs pa dang / lo bas skyen pa dang / yun ring du mi brjed par nus pa dang / don sems pa dang / rtogs par byed nus pa dang ; sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab la rig pas rtogs pa dang ldan pas blo mi 'gyur ba dang ldan te /
analyzed: shin tu yid gzhungs pa dang / lo bas skyen pa dang / yun ring du mi brjed par nus pa dang / don sems pa dang / rtogs par byed nus pa dang ; sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab la rig pas rtogs pa dang ldan pas blo mi 'gyur ba dang ldan te /
translated: They have very sharp minds, are quick to learn, are able to retain what they have learned for a long time, are able to reflect on the meaning, are able to understand it, and have an unchanging intelligence that is endowed with the realization of the Buddha's teachings through their own knowledge.

original: de las nyis 'gyur du nyin gcig bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab la brtson par byed na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de las nyis 'gyur du nyin gcig bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab la brtson par byed na nyes pa med do //
translated: If they apply themselves to the Buddha's teachings twice as much as they do to the non-Buddhist treatises, there is no fault.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpas de lta bu'i tshul dang yang ma 'gal bar mu stegs can gyi bstan bcos phyi rol gyi bstan bcos dag la mkhas par byed pa na /
translated: When bodhisattvas, without contradicting such a way of acting, become learned in the non-Buddhist treatises of the tƒ´rthikas,

analyzed: der mngon par dga' ba'i tshul gyis byed cing des dga' bar 'dzin la des rangs par byed de /

original: sman tsha ba bsten pa bzhin du mi byed na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sman tsha ba bsten pa bzhin du mi byed na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: If they do not act like someone who relies on a hot medicine, they commit an offense and a transgression.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las de kho na'i don nam /üîΩsangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i mthu las brtsams te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro // byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las de kho na'i don nam / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i mthu las brtsams te /
translated: It is a flaw that is emotionally tainted.üîΩWhen bodhisattvas hear the profound teachings of the bodhisattva collection,

original: zab pa mchog tu zab pa'i gnas dag thos nas /
analyzed: zab pa mchog tu zab pa'i gnas dag thos nas /
translated: whether they are about suchness or about the powers of the buddhas and bodhisattvas,

analyzed: ma mos shing skur pa 'debs te / 'di @94a * //
translated: they should not disparage them, saying,üîΩ‚ÄúThese were not spoken by the TathƒÅgata.

original: dag ni don dang ldan pa ma yin /
analyzed: dag ni don dang ldan pa ma yin /
translated: They are not meaningful.

original: chos dang ldan pa ma yin /
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa ma yin /

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: nad pa mgon yod cing rten yod na nyes pa med do //

analyzed: bdag nyid kyis bdag gi rim gro dang bsnyen bkur byed nus na nyes pa med do //

analyzed: nad rgyun rings kyis thebs te so tsam du 'dug na nyes pa med do //

analyzed: gzhan la ches sngar khas blangs na nyes pa med do //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma'i don la tshul ma yin par zhugs pa dag mthong na /

analyzed: bdag gis mi shes te mi nus na nyes pa med do //
